verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:1
verses.text: On the third day, God planted the garden in the east of the earth, on the border of the world eastward, beyond which, towards the sun-rising, one finds nothing but water, that encompasses the whole world, and reaches to the borders of heaven.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:2
verses.text: And to the north of the garden there is a sea of water, clear and pure to the taste, unlike anything else; so that, through the clearness thereof, one may look into the depths of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:3
verses.text: And when a man washes himself in it, he becomes clean of the cleanness thereof, and white of its whiteness--even if he were dark.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:4
verses.text: And God created that sea of his own good pleasure, for He knew what would come of the man He would make; so that after he had left the garden, on account of his transgression, men should be born in the earth.  Among them are righteous ones who will die, whose souls God would raise at the last day; when all of them will return to their flesh, bathe in the water of that sea, and repent of their sins.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:5
verses.text: But when God made Adam go out of the garden, He did not place him on the border of it northward.  This was so that he and Eve would not be able to go near to the sea of water where they could wash themselves in it, be cleansed from their sins, erase the transgression they had committed, and be no longer reminded of it in the thought of their punishment.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:6
verses.text: As to the southern side of the garden, God did not want Adam to live there either; because, when the wind blew from the north, it would bring him, on that southern side, the delicious smell of the trees of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:7
verses.text: Wherefore God did not put Adam there.  This was so that he would not be able to smell the sweet smell of those trees, forget his transgression, and find consolation for what he had done by taking delight in the smell of the trees and yet not be cleansed from his transgression.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:8
verses.text: Again, also, because God is merciful and of great pity, and governs all things in a way that He alone knows--He made our father Adam live in the western border of the garden, because on that side the earth is very broad.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 1:9
verses.text: And God commanded him to live there in a cave in a rock--the Cave of Treasures below the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 2:1
verses.text: But when our father Adam, and Eve, went out of the garden, they walked the ground on their feet, not knowing they were walking.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 2:2
verses.text: And when they came to the opening of the gate of the garden, and saw the broad earth spread before them, covered with stones large and small, and with sand, they feared and trembled, and fell on their faces, from the fear that came over them; and they were as dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 2:3
verses.text: Because--whereas until this time they had been in the garden land, beautifully planted with all manner of trees--they now saw themselves, in a strange land, which they knew not, and had never seen.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 2:4
verses.text: And because, when they were in the garden they were filled with the grace of a bright nature, and they had not hearts turned toward earthly things.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 2:5
verses.text: Therefore God had pity on them; and when He saw them fallen before the gate of the garden, He sent His Word to our father, Adam and Eve, and raised them from their fallen state.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:1
verses.text: God said to Adam, "I have ordained on this earth days and years, and you and your descendants shall live and walk in them, until the days and years are fulfilled; when I shall send the Word that created you, and against which you have transgressed, the Word that made you come out of the garden, and that raised you when you were fallen.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:2
verses.text: Yes, the Word that will again save you when the five and a half days are fulfilled."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:3
verses.text: But when Adam heard these words from God, and of the great five and a half days, he did not understand the meaning of them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:4
verses.text: For Adam was thinking there would be only five and a half days for him until the end of the world.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:5
verses.text: And Adam cried, and prayed to God to explain it to him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:6
verses.text: Then God in his mercy for Adam who was made after His own image and likeness, explained to him, that these were 5,000 and 500 years; and how One would then come and save him and his descendants.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:7
verses.text: But before that, God had made this covenant with our father, Adam, in the same terms, before he came out of the garden, when he was by the tree where Eve took of the fruit and gave it to him to eat.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:8
verses.text: Because, when our father Adam came out of the garden, he passed by that tree, and saw how God had changed the appearance of it into another form, and how it shriveled.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:9
verses.text: And as Adam went to it he feared, trembled and fell down; but God in His mercy lifted him up, and then made this covenant with him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:10
verses.text: And again, when Adam was by the gate of the garden, and saw the cherub with a sword of flashing fire in his hand, and the cherub grew angry and frowned at him, both Adam and Eve became afraid of him, and thought he meant to put them to death. So they fell on their faces, trembled with fear.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:11
verses.text: But he had pity on them, and showed them mercy; and turning from them went up to heaven, and prayed to the Lord, and said;--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:12
verses.text: "Lord, You sent me to watch at the gate of the garden, with a sword of fire.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:13
verses.text: But when Your servants, Adam and Eve, saw me, they fell on their faces, and were as dead.  O my Lord, what shall we do to Your servants?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:14
verses.text: Then God had pity on them, and showed them mercy, and sent His Angel to keep the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:15
verses.text: And the Word of the Lord came to Adam and Eve, and raised them up.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:16
verses.text: And the Lord said to Adam, "I told you that at the end of the five and a half days, I will send my Word and save you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:17
verses.text: Strengthen your heart, therefore, and stay in the Cave of Treasures, of which I have before spoken to you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 3:18
verses.text: And when Adam heard this Word from God, he was comforted with that which God had told him. For He had told him how He would save him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:1
verses.text: But Adam and Eve cried for having come out of the garden, their first home.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:2
verses.text: And indeed, when Adam looked at his flesh, that was altered, he cried bitterly, he and Eve, over what they had done.  And they walked and went gently down into the Cave of Treasures.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:3
verses.text: And as they came to it, Adam cried over himself and said to Eve, "Look at this cave that is to be our prison in this world, and a place of punishment!

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:4
verses.text: What is it compared with the garden? What is its narrowness compared with the space of the other?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:5
verses.text: What is this rock, by the side of those groves? What is the gloom of this cavern, compared with the light of the garden?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:6
verses.text: What is this overhanging ledge of rock to shelter us, compared with the mercy of the Lord that overshadowed us?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:7
verses.text: What is the soil of this cave compared with the garden land? This earth, strewed with stones; and that, planted with delicious fruit trees?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:8
verses.text: And Adam said to Eve, "Look at your eyes, and at mine, which before beheld angels praising in heaven; and they too, without ceasing.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:9
verses.text: But now we do not see as we did; our eyes have become of flesh; they cannot see like they used to see before."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:10
verses.text: Adam said again to Eve, "What is our body today, compared to what it was in former days, when we lived in the garden?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:11
verses.text: After this, Adam did not want to enter the cave, under the overhanging rock; nor would he ever want to enter it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 4:12
verses.text: But he bowed to God's orders; and said to himself, "Unless I enter the cave, I shall again be a transgressor."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:1
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve entered the cave, and stood praying, in their own tongue, unknown to us, but which they knew well.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:2
verses.text: And as they prayed, Adam raised his eyes and saw the rock and the roof of the cave that covered him overhead.  This prevented him from seeing either heaven or God's creatures. So he cried and beat his chest hard, until he dropped, and was as dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:3
verses.text: And Eve sat crying; for she believed he was dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:4
verses.text: Then she got up, spread her hands toward God, appealing to Him for mercy and pity, and said, "O God, forgive me my sin, the sin which I committed, and don't remember it against me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:5
verses.text: For I alone caused Your servant to fall from the garden into this condemned land; from light into this darkness; and from the house of joy into this prison.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:6
verses.text: O God, look at this Your servant fallen in this manner, and bring him back to life, that he may cry and repent of his transgression which he committed through me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:7
verses.text: Don't take away his soul right now; but let him live that he may stand after the measure of his repentance, and do Your will, as before his death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:8
verses.text: But if You do not bring him back to life, then, O God, take away my own soul, that I be like him, and leave me not in this dungeon, one and alone; for I could not stand alone in this world, but with him only.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:9
verses.text: For You, O God, caused him to fall asleep, and took a bone from his side, and restored the flesh  in the place of it, by Your divine power.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:10
verses.text: And You took me, the bone, and make me a woman, bright like him, with heart, reason, and speech; and in flesh, like to his own; and You made me after the likeness of his looks, by Your mercy and power.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:11
verses.text: O Lord, I and he are one, and You, O God, are our Creator, You are He who made us both in one day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:12
verses.text: Therefore, O God, give him life, that he may be with me in this strange land, while we live in it on account of our transgression.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:13
verses.text: But if You will not give him life, then take me, even me, like him; that we both may die the same day."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 5:14
verses.text: And Eve cried bitterly, and fell on our father Adam; from her great sorrow.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:1
verses.text: But God looked at them; for they had killed themselves through greatgrief.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:2
verses.text: But He decided to raise them and comfort them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:3
verses.text: He, therefore, sent His Word to them; that they should stand and be raised immediately.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:4
verses.text: And the Lord said to Adam and Eve, "You transgressed of your own free will, until you came out of the garden in which I had placed you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:5
verses.text: Of your own free will have you transgressed through your desire for divinity, greatness, and an exalted state, such as I have; so that I deprived you of the bright nature in which you then were, and I made you come out of the garden to this land, rough and full of trouble.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:6
verses.text: If only you had not transgressed My commandment and had kept My law, and had not eaten of the fruit of the tree which I told you not to come near! And there were fruit trees in the garden better than that one.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:7
verses.text: But the wicked Satan did not keep his faith and had no good intent towards Me, that although I had created him, he considered Me to be useless, and sought the Godhead for himself; for this I hurled him down from heaven so that he could not remain in his first estate--it was he who made the tree appear pleasant in your eyes, until you ate of it, by believing his words.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:8
verses.text: Thus have you transgressed My commandment, and therefore I have brought on you all these sorrows.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:9
verses.text: For I am God the Creator, who, when I created My creatures, did not intend to destroy them. But after they had sorely roused My anger,I punished them with grievous plagues, until they repent.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 6:10
verses.text: But, if on the contrary, they still continue hardened in their transgression, they shall be under a curse forever."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:1
verses.text: When Adam and Eve heard these words from God, they cried and sobbed yet more; but they strengthened their hearts in God, because they now felt that the Lord was to them like a father and a mother; and for this very reason, they cried before Him, and sought mercy from Him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:2
verses.text: Then God had pity on them, and said: "O Adam, I have made My covenant with you, and I will not turn from it; neither will I let you return to the garden, until My covenant of the great five and a half days is fulfilled."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:3
verses.text: Then Adam said to God, "O Lord, You created us, and made us fit to be in the garden; and before I transgressed, You made all beasts come to me, that I should name them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:4
verses.text: Your grace was then on me; and I named every one according to Your mind; and you made them all subject to me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:5
verses.text: But now, O Lord God, that I have transgressed Your commandment, all beasts will rise against me and will devour me, and Eve Your handmaid; and will cut off our life from the face of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:6
verses.text: I therefore beg you, O God, that since You have made us come out of the garden, and have made us be in a strange land, You will not let the beasts hurt us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:7
verses.text: When the Lord heard these words from Adam, He had pity on him, and felt that he had truly said that the beasts of the field would rise and devour him and Eve, because He, the Lord, was angry with the two of them on account of their transgressions.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:8
verses.text: Then God commanded the beasts, and the birds, and all that moves on the earth, to come to Adam and to be familiar with him, and not to trouble him and Eve; nor yet any of the good and righteous among their offspring.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 7:9
verses.text: Then all the beasts paid homage to Adam, according to the commandment of God; except the serpent, against which God was angry. It did not come to Adam, with the beasts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 8:1
verses.text: Then Adam cried and said, "O God, when we lived in the garden, and our hearts were lifted up, we saw the angels that sang praises in heaven, but now we can't see like we used to; no, when we entered the cave, all creation became hidden from us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 8:2
verses.text: Then God the Lord said to Adam, "When you were under subjection to Me, you had a bright nature within you, and for that reason could you see things far away.  But after your transgression your bright nature was withdrawn from you; and it was not left to you to see things far away, but only near at hand; after the ability of the flesh; for it is brutish."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 8:3
verses.text: When Adam and Eve had heard these words from God, they went their way; praising and worshipping Him with a sorrowful heart.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 8:4
verses.text: And God ceased to commune with them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:1
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve came out of the Cave of Treasures, and went near to the garden gate, and there they stood to look at it, and cried for having come away from it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:2
verses.text: And Adam and Eve went from before the gate of the garden to the southern side of it, and found there the water that watered the garden, from the root of the Tree of Life, and that split itself from there into four rivers over the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:3
verses.text: Then they came and went near to that water, and looked at it; and saw that it was the water that came forth from under the root of the Tree of Life in the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:4
verses.text: And Adam cried and wailed, and beat his chest, for being severed from the garden; and said to Eve:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:5
verses.text: "Why have you brought on me, on yourself, and on our descendants, so many of these plagues and punishments?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:6
verses.text: And Eve said to him, "What is it you have seen that has caused you to cry and to speak to me in this manner?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:7
verses.text: And he said to Eve, "Do you not see this water that was with us in the garden, that watered the trees of the garden, and flowed out from there?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:8
verses.text: And we, when we were in the garden, did not care about it; but since we came to this strange land, we love it, and turn it to use for our body."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 9:9
verses.text: But when Eve heard these words from him, she cried; and from the soreness of their crying, they fell into that water; and would have put an end to themselves in it, so as never again to return and behold the creation; for when they looked at the work of creation, they felt they must put an end to themselves.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:1
verses.text: Then God, merciful and gracious, looked at them thus lying in the water, and close to death, and sent an angel, who brought them out of the water, and laid them on the seashore as dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:2
verses.text: Then the angel went up to God, was welcome, and said, "O God, Your creatures have breathed their last."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:3
verses.text: Then God sent His Word to Adam and Eve, who raised them from their death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:4
verses.text: And Adam said, after he was raised, "O God, while we were in the garden we did not require, or care for this water; but since we came to this land we cannot do without it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:5
verses.text: Then God said to Adam, "While you were under My command and were a bright angel, you knew not this water.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:6
verses.text: But now that you have transgressed My commandment, you can not do without water, wherein to wash your body and make it grow; for it is now like that of beasts, and is in want of water."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:7
verses.text: When Adam and Eve heard these words from God, they cried a bitter cry; and Adam entreated God to let him return into the garden, and look at it a second time.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:8
verses.text: But God said to Adam, "I have made you a promise; when that promise is fulfilled, I will bring you back into the garden, you and your righteous descendants."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 10:9
verses.text: And God ceased to commune with Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:1
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve felt themselves burning with thirst, and heat, and sorrow.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:2
verses.text: And Adam said to Eve, "We shall not drink of this water, even if we were to die.  O Eve, when this water comes into our inner parts, it will increase our punishments and that of our descendants."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:3
verses.text: Both Adam and Eve then went away from the water, and drank none of it at all; but came and entered the Cave of Treasures.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:4
verses.text: But when in it Adam could not see Eve; he only heard the noise she made.  Neither could she see Adam, but heard the noise he made.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:5
verses.text: Then Adam cried, in deep affliction, and beat his chest; and he got up and said to Eve, "Where are you?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:6
verses.text: And she said to him, "Look, I am standing in this darkness."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:7
verses.text: He then said to her, "Remember the bright nature in which we lived, when we lived in the garden!

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:8
verses.text: O Eve!  Remember the glory that rested on us in the garden. O Eve! Remember the trees that overshadowed us in the garden while we moved among them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:9
verses.text: O Eve! Remember that while we were in the garden, we knew neither night nor day. Think of the Tree of Life, from below which flowed the water, and that shed lustre over us!  Remember, O Eve, the garden land, and the brightness thereof!

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:10
verses.text: Think, oh think of that garden in which was no darkness, while we lived in it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 11:11
verses.text: Whereas no sooner did we come into this Cave of Treasures than darkness surrounded us all around; until we can no longer see each other; and all the pleasure of this life has come to an end."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:1
verses.text: Then Adam beat his chest, he and Eve, and they mourned the whole night until the crack of dawn, and they sighed over the length of the night in Miyazia.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:2
verses.text: And Adam beat himself, and threw himself on the ground in the cave, from bitter grief, and because of the darkness, and lay there as dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:3
verses.text: But Eve heard the noise he made in falling on the ground. And she felt about for him with her hands, and found him like a corpse.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:4
verses.text: Then she was afraid, speechless, and remained by him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:5
verses.text: But the merciful Lord looked on the death of Adam, and on Eve's silence from fear of the darkness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:6
verses.text: And the Word of God came to Adam and raised him from his death, and opened Eve's mouth that she might speak.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:7
verses.text: Then Adam stood up in the cave and said, "O God, why has light departed from us, and darkness covered us?  Why did you leave us in this long darkness?  Why do you plague us like this?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:8
verses.text: And this darkness, O Lord, where was it before it covered us?  It is because of this that we cannot see each other.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:9
verses.text: For so long as we were in the garden, we neither saw nor even knew what darkness is.  I was not hidden from Eve, neither was she hidden from me, until now that she cannot see me; and no darkness came over us to separate us from each other.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:10
verses.text: But she and I were both in one bright light.  I saw her and she saw me.  Yet now since we came into this cave, darkness has covered us, and separated us from each other, so that I do not see her, and she does not see me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 12:11
verses.text: O Lord, will You then plague us with this darkness?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:1
verses.text: Then when God, who is merciful and full of pity, heard Adam's voice, He said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:2
verses.text: "O Adam, so long as the good angel was obedient to Me, a bright light rested on him and on his hosts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:3
verses.text: But when he transgressed My commandment, I deprived him of that bright nature, and he became dark.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:4
verses.text: And when he was in the heavens, in the realms of light, he knew nothing of darkness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:5
verses.text: But he transgressed, and I made him fall from the heaven onto the earth; and it was this darkness that came over him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:6
verses.text: And on you, O Adam, while in My garden and obedient to Me, did that bright light rest also.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:7
verses.text: But when I heard of your transgression, I deprived you of that bright light.  Yet, of My mercy, I did not turn you into darkness, but I made you your body of flesh, over which I spread this skin, in order that it may bear cold and heat.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:8
verses.text: If I had let My wrath fall heavily on you, I should have destroyed you; and had I turned you into darkness, it would have been as if I had killed you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:9
verses.text: But in My mercy, I have made you as you are; when you transgressed My commandment, O Adam, I drove you from the garden, and made you come forth into this land; and commanded you to live in this cave; and darkness covered you, as it did over him who transgressed My commandment.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:10
verses.text: Thus, O Adam, has this night deceived you.  It is not to last forever; but is only of twelve hours; when it is over, daylight will return.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:11
verses.text: Sigh not, therefore, neither be moved; and say not in your heart that this darkness is long and drags on wearily; and say not in your heart that I plague you with it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:12
verses.text: Strengthen your heart, and be not afraid. This darkness is not a punishment. But, O Adam, I have made the day, and have placed the sun in it to give light; in order that you and your children should do your work.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:13
verses.text: For I knew you would sin and transgress, and come out into this land. Yet I wouldn't force you, nor be heard over you, nor shut up; nor doom you through your fall; nor through your coming out from light into darkness; nor yet through your coming from the garden into this land.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:14
verses.text: For I made you of the light; and I willed to bring out children of light from you and like to you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:15
verses.text: But you did not keep My commandment one day; until I had finished the creation and blessed everything in it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:16
verses.text: Then, concerning the tree, I commanded you not to eat of it. Yet I knew that Satan, who deceived himself, would also deceive you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:17
verses.text: So I made known to you by means of the tree, not to come near him. And I told you not to eat of the fruit thereof, nor to taste of it, nor yet to sit under it, nor to yield to it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:18
verses.text: Had I not been and spoken to you, O Adam, concerning the tree, and had I left you without a commandment, and you had sinned--it would have been an offence on My part, for not having given you any order; you would turn around and blame Me for it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:19
verses.text: But I commanded you, and warned you, and you fell. So that My creatures cannot blame Me; but the blame rests on them alone.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:20
verses.text: And, O Adam, I have made the day so that you and your descendants can work and toil in it.  And I have made the night for them to rest in it from their work; and for the beasts of the field to go forth by night and look for their food.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 13:21
verses.text: But little of darkness now remains, O Adam, and daylight will soon appear."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 14:1
verses.text: Then Adam said to God: "O Lord, take You my soul, and let me not see this gloom any more; or remove me to some place where there is no darkness."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 14:2
verses.text: But God the Lord said to Adam, "Indeed I say to you, this darkness will pass from you, every day I have determined for you, until the fulfillment of My covenant; when I will save you and bring you back again into the garden, into the house of light you long for, in which there is no darkness. I will bring you to it--in the kingdom of heaven."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 14:3
verses.text: Again said God to Adam, "All this misery that you have been made to take on yourself because of your transgression, will not free you from the hand of Satan, and will not save you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 14:4
verses.text: But I will. When I shall come down from heaven, and shall become flesh of your descendants, and take on Myself the infirmity from which you suffer, then the darkness that covered you in this cave shall cover Me in the grave, when I am in the flesh of your descendants.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 14:5
verses.text: And I, who am without years, shall be subject to the reckoning of years, of times, of months, and of days, and I shall be reckoned as one of the sons of men, in order to save you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 14:6
verses.text: And God ceased to commune with Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 15:1
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve cried and sorrowed by reason of God's word to them, that they should not return to the garden until the fulfillment of the days decreed on them; but mostly because God had told them that He should suffer for their salvation.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:1
verses.text: After this, Adam and Eve continued to stand in the cave, praying and crying, until the morning dawned on them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:2
verses.text: And when they saw the light returned to them, they retrained from fear, and strengthened their hearts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:3
verses.text: Then Adam began to come out of the cave. And when he came to the mouth of it, and stood and turned his face towards the east, and saw the sunrise in glowing rays, and felt the heat thereof on his body, he was afraid of it, and thought in his heart that this flame came forth to plague him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:4
verses.text: He then cried and beat his chest, then he fell on the ground on his face and made his request, saying:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:5
verses.text: "O Lord, plague me not, neither consume me, nor yet take away my life from the earth."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:6
verses.text: For he thought the sun was God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:7
verses.text: Because while he was in the garden and heard the voice of God and the sound He made in the garden, and feared Him, Adam never saw the brilliant light of the sun, neither did its flaming heat touch his body.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:8
verses.text: Therefore he was afraid of the sun when flaming rays of it reached him.  He thought God meant to plague him therewith all the days He had decreed for him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:9
verses.text: For Adam also said in his thoughts, as God did not plague us with darkness, behold, He has caused this sun to rise and to plague us with burning heat.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:10
verses.text: But while he was thinking like this in his heart, the Word of God came to him and said:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:11
verses.text: "O Adam, get up on your feet. This sun is not God; but it has been created to give light by day, of which I spoke to you in the cave saying, 'that the dawn would come, and there would be light by day.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:12
verses.text: But I am God who comforted you in the night."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 16:13
verses.text: And God ceased to commune with Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 17:1
verses.text: The Adam and Eve came out at the mouth of the cave, and went towards the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 17:2
verses.text: But as they went near it, before the western gate, from which Satan came when he deceived Adam and Eve, they found the serpent that became Satan coming at the gate, and sorrowfully licking the dust, and wiggling on its breast on the ground, by reason of the curse that fell on it from God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 17:3
verses.text: And whereas before the serpent was the most exalted of all beasts, now it was changed and become slippery, and the meanest of them all, and it crept on its breast and went on its belly.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 17:4
verses.text: And whereas it was the fairest of all beasts, it had been changed, and was become the ugliest of them all. Instead of feeding on the best food, now it turned to eat the dust. Instead of living, as before, in the best places, now it lived in the dust.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 17:5
verses.text: And, whereas it had been the most beautiful of all beasts, all of which stood dumb at its beauty, it was now abhorred of them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 17:6
verses.text: And, again, whereas it lived in one beautiful home, to which all other animals came from elsewhere; and where it drank, they drank also of the same; now, after it had become venomous, by reason of God's curse, all beasts fled from its home, and would not drink of the water it drank; but fled from it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:1
verses.text: When the accursed serpent saw Adam and Eve, it swelled its head, stood on its tail, and with eyes blood-red, acted like it would kill them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:2
verses.text: It made straight for Eve, and ran after her; while Adam standing by, cried because he had no stick in his hand with which to hit the serpent, and did not know how to put it to death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:3
verses.text: But with a heart burning for Eve, Adam approached the serpent, and held it by the tail; when it turned towards him and said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:4
verses.text: "O Adam, because of you and of Eve, I am slippery, and go on my belly."  Then with its great strength, it threw down Adam and Eve and squeezed them, and tried to kill them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:5
verses.text: But God sent an angel who threw the serpent away from them, and raised them up.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:6
verses.text: Then the Word of God came to the serpent, and said to it, "The first time I made you slick, and made you to go on your belly; but I did not deprive you of speech.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:7
verses.text: This time, however, you will be mute, and you and your race will speak no more; because, the first time My creatures were ruined because of you, and this time you tried to kill them."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:8
verses.text: Then the serpent was struck mute, and was no longer able to speak.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 18:9
verses.text: And a wind blew down from heaven by the command of God and carried away the serpent from Adam and Eve, and threw it on the seashore where it landed in India.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 19:1
verses.text: But Adam and Eve cried before God.  And Adam said to Him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 19:2
verses.text: "O Lord, when I was in the cave, I said this to you, my Lord, the beasts of the field would rise and devour me, and cut off my life from the earth."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 19:3
verses.text: Then Adam, because of what had happened to him, beat his chest and fell on the ground like a corpse. Then the Word of God came to him, who raised him, and said to him,

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 19:4
verses.text: "O Adam, not one of these beasts will be able to hurt you; because I have made the beasts and other moving things come to you in the cave. I did not let the serpent come with them because it might have risen against you and made you tremble; and the fear of it should fall into your hearts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 19:5
verses.text: For I knew that the accursed one is wicked; therefore I would not let it come near you with the other beasts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 19:6
verses.text: But now strengthen your heart and fear not. I am with you to the end of the days I have determined on you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 20:1
verses.text: Then Adam cried and said, "O God, take us away to some other place, where the serpent can not come near us again, and rise against us.  For fear that it might find Your handmaid Eve alone and kill her; for its eyes are hideous and evil."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 20:2
verses.text: But God said to Adam and Eve, "From now on, don't be afraid, I will not let it come near you; I have driven it away from you, from this mountain; neither will I leave in it the ability to hurt you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 20:3
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve worshipped before God and gave Him thanks, and praised Him for having delivered them from death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:1
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve went in search of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:2
verses.text: And the heat beat like a flame on their faces; and they sweated from the heat, and cried before the Lord.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:3
verses.text: But the place where they cried was close to a high mountain, facing the western gate of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:4
verses.text: Then Adam threw himself down from the top of that mountain; his face was torn and his flesh was ripped; he lost a lot of blood and was close to death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:5
verses.text: Meanwhile Eve remained standing on the mountain crying over him, thus lying.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:6
verses.text: And she said, "I don't wish to live after him; for all that he did to himself was through me."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:7
verses.text: Then she threw herself after him; and was torn and ripped by stones; and remained lying as dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:8
verses.text: But the merciful God, who looks over His creatures, looked at Adam and Eve as they lay dead, and He sent His Word to them, and raised them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 21:9
verses.text: And said to Adam, "O Adam, all this misery which you have brought on yourself, will have no affect against My rule, neither will it alter the covenant of the 5,500 years."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 22:1
verses.text: Then Adam said to God, "I dry up in the heat, I am faint from walking, and I don't want to be in this world.  And I don't know when You will take me out of it to rest."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 22:2
verses.text: Then the Lord God said to him, "O Adam, it cannot be now, not until you have ended your days.  Then shall I bring you out of this miserable land."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 22:3
verses.text: And Adam said to God, "While I was in the garden I knew neither heat, nor languor, neither moving about, nor trembling, nor fear; but now since I came to this land, all this affliction has come over me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 22:4
verses.text: Then God said to Adam, "So long as you were keeping My commandment, My light and My grace rested on you.  But when you transgressed My commandment, sorrow and misery came to you in this land."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 22:5
verses.text: And Adam cried and said, "O Lord, do not cut me off for this, neither punish me with heavy plagues, nor yet repay me according to my sin; for we, of our own will, transgressed Your commandment, and ignored Your law, and tried to become gods like you, when Satan the enemy deceived us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 22:6
verses.text: Then God said again to Adam, "Because you have endured fear and trembling in this land, languor and suffering, treading and walking about, going on this mountain, and dying from it, I will take all this on Myself in order to save you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:1
verses.text: Then Adam cried more and said, "O God, have mercy on me, so far as to take on yourself, that which I will do."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:2
verses.text: But God withdrew His Word from Adam and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:3
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve stood on their feet; and Adam said to Eve, "Strengthen yourself, and I also will strengthen myself." And she strengthened herself, as Adam told her.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:4
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve took stones and placed them in the shape of an altar; and they took leaves from the trees outside the garden, with which they wiped, from the face of the rock, the blood they had spilled.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:5
verses.text: But that which had dropped on the sand, they took together with the dust with which it was mingled and offered it on the altar as an offering to God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:6
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve stood under the Altar and cried, thus praying to God, "Forgive us our trespass and our sin, and look at us with Thine eye of mercy.  For when we were in the garden our praises and our hymns went up before you without ceasing.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:7
verses.text: But when we came into this strange land, pure praise was not longer ours, nor righteous prayer, nor understanding hearts, nor sweet thoughts, nor just counsels, nor long discernment, nor upright feelings, neither is our bright nature left us.  But our body is changed from the likeness in which it was at first, when we were created.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:8
verses.text: Yet now look at our blood which is offered on these stones, and accept it at our hands, like the praise we used to sing to you at first, when in the garden."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 23:9
verses.text: And Adam began to make more requests of God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:1
verses.text: Then the merciful God, good and lover of men, looked at Adam and Eve, and at their blood, which they had held up as an offering to Him; without an order from Him for so doing.  But He wondered at them; and accepted their offerings.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:2
verses.text: And God sent from His presence a bright fire, that consumed their offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:3
verses.text: He smelled the sweet savor of their offering, and showed them mercy.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:4
verses.text: Then came the Word of God to Adam, and said to him, "O Adam, as you have shed your blood, so will I shed My own blood when I become flesh of your descendants; and as you died, O Adam, so also will I die. And as you built an altar, so also will I make for you an altar of the earth; and as you offered your blood on it, so also will I offer My blood on an altar on the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:5
verses.text: And as you sued for forgiveness through that blood, so also will I make My blood forgiveness of sins, and erase transgressions in it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:6
verses.text: And now, behold, I have accepted your offering, O Adam, but the days of the covenant in which I have bound you are not fulfilled. When they are fulfilled, then will I bring you back into the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 24:7
verses.text: Now, therefore, strengthen your heart; and when sorrow comes over you, make Me an offering, and I will be favorable to you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:1
verses.text: But God knew that Adam believed he should frequently kill himself and make an offering to Him of his blood.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:2
verses.text: Therefore He said to him, "O Adam, don't ever kill yourself like this again, by throwing yourself down from that mountain."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:3
verses.text: But Adam said to God, "I was thinking to put an end to myself at once, for having transgressed Your commandments, and for my having come out of the beautiful garden; and for the bright light of which You have deprived me; and for the praises which poured forth from my mouth without ceasing, and for the light that covered me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:4
verses.text: Yet of Your goodness, O God, do not get rid of me altogether; but be favorable to me every time I die, and bring me to life.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:5
verses.text: And thereby it will be made known that You are a merciful God, who does not want anyone to perish; who loves not that one should fall; and who does not condemn any one cruelly, badly, and by whole destruction."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:6
verses.text: Then Adam remained silent.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:7
verses.text: And the Word of God came to him, and blessed him, and comforted him, and covenanted with him, that He would save him at the end of the days determined for him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 25:8
verses.text: This, then, was the first offering Adam made to God; and so it became his custom to do.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:1
verses.text: Then Adam took Eve, and they began to return to the Cave of Treasures where they lived. But when they got closer to it and saw it from a distance, heavy sorrow fell on Adam and Eve when they looked at it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:2
verses.text: Then Adam said to Eve, "When we were on the mountain we were comforted by the Word of God that conversed with us; and the light that came from the east shown over us.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:3
verses.text: But now the Word of God is hidden from us; and the light that shown over us is so changed as to disappear, and let darkness and sorrow come over us.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:4
verses.text: And we are forced to enter this cave which is like a prison, in which darkness covers us, so that we are separated from each other; and you can not see me, neither can I see you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:5
verses.text: When Adam had said these words, they cried and spread their hands before God; for they were full of sorrow.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:6
verses.text: And they prayed to God to bring the sun to them, to shine on them, so that darkness would not return to them, and that they wouldn't have to go under this covering of rock.  And they wished to die rather than see the darkness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:7
verses.text: Then God looked at Adam and Eve and at their great sorrow, and at all they had done with a fervent heart, on account of all the trouble they were in, instead of their former well-being, and on account of all the misery that came over them in a strange land.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:8
verses.text: Therefore God was not angry with them; nor impatient with them; but he was patient and forbearing towards them, as towards the children He had created.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:9
verses.text: Then came the Word of God to Adam, and said to him, "Adam, as for the sun, if I were to take it and bring it to you, days, hours, years and months would all stop, and the covenant I have made with you, would never be fulfilled.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:10
verses.text: But then you would be deserted and stuck in a perpetual plague, and you would never be saved.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:11
verses.text: Yes, rather, bear long and calm your soul while you live night and day; until the fulfillment of the days, and the time of My covenant is come.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:12
verses.text: Then shall I come and save you, O Adam, for I do not wish that you be afflicted.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:13
verses.text: And when I look at all the good things in which you lived, and why you came out of them, then would I willingly show you mercy.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:14
verses.text: But I cannot alter the covenant that has gone out of My mouth; otherwise I would have brought you back into the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:15
verses.text: When, however, the covenant is fulfilled, then shall I show you and your descendants mercy, and bring you into a land of gladness, where there is neither sorrow nor suffering; but abiding joy and gladness, and light that never fails, and praises that never cease; and a beautiful garden that shall never pass away."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:16
verses.text: And God said again to Adam, "Be patient and enter the cave, for the darkness, of which you were afraid, shall only be twelve hours long; and when ended, light shall come up."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:17
verses.text: Then when Adam heard these words from God, he and Eve worshipped before Him, and their hearts were comforted.  They returned into the cave after their custom, while tears flowed from their eyes, sorrow and wailing came from their hearts, and they wished their soul would leave their body.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:18
verses.text: And Adam and Eve stood praying until the darkness of night came over them, and Adam was hid from Eve, and she from him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 26:19
verses.text: And they remained standing in prayer.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:1
verses.text: When Satan, the hater of all good, saw how they continued in prayer, and how God communed with them, and comforted them, and how He had accepted their offering--Satan made an apparition.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:2
verses.text: He began with transforming his hosts; in his hands was a flashing fire, and they were in a great light.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:3
verses.text: He then placed his throne near the mouth of the cave because he could not enter into it by reason of their prayers. And he shed light into the cave, until the cave glistened over Adam and Eve; while his hosts began to sing praises.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:4
verses.text: And Satan did this, in order that when Adam saw the light, he should think within himself that it was a heavenly light, and that Satan's hosts were angels; and that God had sent them to watch at the cave, and to give him light in the darkness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:5
verses.text: So that when Adam came out of the cave and saw them, and Adam and Eve bowed to Satan, then he would overcome Adam thereby, and a second time humble him before God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:6
verses.text: When, therefore, Adam and Eve saw the light, fancying it was real, they strengthened their hearts; yet, as they were trembling, Adam said to Eve:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:7
verses.text: "Look at that great light, and at those many songs of praise, and at that host standing outside who won't come into our cave. Why don't they tell us what they want, where they are from, what the meaning of this light is, what those praises are, why they have been sent to this place, and why they won't come in?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:8
verses.text: If they were from God, they would come into the cave with us, and would tell us why they were sent."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:9
verses.text: Then Adam stood up and prayed to God with a burning heart, and said:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:10
verses.text: "O Lord, is there in the world another god besides You, who created angels and filled them with light, and sent them to keep us, who would come with them?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:11
verses.text: But, look, we see these hosts that stand at the mouth of the cave; they are in a great light; they sing loud praises.  If they are of some other god than You, tell me; and if they are sent by you, inform me of the reason for which You have sent them."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:12
verses.text: No sooner had Adam said this, than an angel from God appeared to him in the cave, who said to him, "O Adam, fear not.  This is Satan and his hosts; he wishes to deceive you as he deceived you at first. For the first time, he was hidden in the serpent; but this time he is come to you in the likeness of an angel of light; in order that, when you worshipped him, he might enslave you, in the very presence of God."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:13
verses.text: Then the angel went from Adam and seized Satan at the opening of the cave, and stripped him of the pretense he had assumed, and brought him in his own hideous form to Adam and Eve; who were afraid of him when they saw him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:14
verses.text: And the angel said to Adam, "This hideous form has been his ever since God made him fall from heaven. He could not have come near you in it; he therefore transformed himself into an angel of light."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:15
verses.text: Then the angel drove away Satan and his hosts from Adam and Eve, and said to them, "Fear not; God who created you, will strengthen you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:16
verses.text: And the angel left them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:17
verses.text: But Adam and Eve remained standing in the cave; no consolation came to them; they divided in their thoughts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 27:18
verses.text: And when it was morning they prayed; and then went out to seek the garden.  For their hearts were towards it, and they could get no consolation for having left it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:1
verses.text: But when the crafty Satan saw them, that they were going to the garden, he gathered together his host, and came in appearance on a cloud, intent on deceiving them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:2
verses.text: But when Adam and Eve saw him thus in a vision, they thought they were angels of God come to comfort them about having left the garden, or to bring them back again into it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:3
verses.text: And Adam spread his hands before God, beseeching Him to make him understand what they were.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:4
verses.text: Then Satan, the hater of all good, said to Adam, "O Adam, I am an angel of the great God; and, behold the hosts that surround me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:5
verses.text: God has sent us to take you and bring you to the border of the garden northwards; to the shore of the clear sea, and bathe you and Eve in it, and raise you to your former gladness, that you return again to the garden."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:6
verses.text: These words sank into the heart of Adam and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:7
verses.text: Yet God withheld His Word from Adam, and did not make him understand at once, but waited to see his strength; whether he would be overcome as Eve was when in the garden, or whether he would prevail.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:8
verses.text: Then Satan called to Adam and Eve, and said, "Behold, we go to the sea of water," and they began to go.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:9
verses.text: And Adam and Eve followed them at some little distance.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 28:10
verses.text: But when they came to the mountain to the north of the garden, a very high mountain, without any steps to the top of it, the Devil drew near to Adam and Eve, and made them go up to the top in reality, and not in a vision; wishing, as he did, to throw them down and kill them, and to wipe off their name from the earth; so that this earth should remain to him and his hosts alone.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:1
verses.text: But when the merciful God saw that Satan wished to kill Adam with his many tricks, and saw that Adam was meek and without guile, God spoke to Satan in a loud voice, and cursed him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:2
verses.text: Then he and his hosts fled, and Adam and Eve remained standing on the top of the mountain, from there they saw below them the wide world, high above which they were.  But they saw none of the host which time after time were by them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:3
verses.text: They cried, both Adam and Eve, before God, and begged for forgiveness of Him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:4
verses.text: Then came the Word from God to Adam, and said to him, "Know you and understand concerning this Satan, that he seeks to deceive you and your descendants after you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:5
verses.text: And Adam cried before the Lord God, and begged and prayed to Him to give him something from the garden, as a token to him, wherein to be comforted.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:6
verses.text: And God considered Adam's thought, and sent the angel Michael as far as the sea that reaches India, to take from there golden rods and bring them to Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:7
verses.text: This did God in His wisdom in order that these golden rods, being with Adam in the cave, should shine forth with light in the night around him, and put an end to his fear of the darkness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 29:8
verses.text: Then the angel Michael went down by God's order, took golden rods, as God had commanded him, and brought them to God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:1
verses.text: After these things, God commanded the angel Gabriel to go down to the garden, and say to the cherub who kept it, "Behold, God has commanded me to come into the garden, and to take from it sweet smelling incense, and give it to Adam."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:2
verses.text: Then the angel Gabriel went down by God's order to the garden, and told the cherub as God had commanded him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:3
verses.text: The cherub then said, "Well." And Gabriel went in and took the incense.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:4
verses.text: Then God commanded his angel Raphael to go down to the garden, and speak to the cherub about some myrrh, to give to Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:5
verses.text: And the angel Raphael went down and told the cherub as God hadcommanded him, and the cherub said, "Well." Then Raphael went in and took the myrrh.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:6
verses.text: The golden rods were from the Indian sea, where there are precious stones. The incense was from the eastern border of the garden; and the myrrh from the western border, from where bitterness came over Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:7
verses.text: And the angels brought these things to God, by the Tree of Life, in the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:8
verses.text: Then God said to the angels, "Dip them in the spring of water; then take them and sprinkle their water over Adam and Eve, that they be a little comforted in their sorrow, and give them to Adam and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:9
verses.text: And the angels did as God had commanded them, and they gave all those things to Adam and Eve on the top of the mountain on which Satan had placed them, when he sought to make an end of them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 30:10
verses.text: And when Adam saw the golden rods, the incense and the myrrh, he was rejoiced and cried because he thought that the gold was a token of the kingdom from where he had come, that the incense was a token of the bright light which had been taken from him, and that the myrrh was a token of the sorrow in which he was.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:1
verses.text:
After these things God said to Adam, "You asked Me for something from

the garden, to be comforted therewith, and I have given you these three

tokens as a consolation to you; that you trust in Me and in My covenant

with you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:2
verses.text:
For I will come and save you; and kings shall bring me when in the

flesh, gold, incense and myrrh; gold as a token of My kingdom; incense

as a token of My divinity; and myrrh as a token of My suffering and of

My death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:3
1 Adam and Eve 31:4
verses.text:
When Adam heard these words from God, he worshipped before Him.  He

and Eve worshipped Him and gave Him thanks, because He had dealt

mercifully with them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:5
verses.text:
Then God commanded the three angels, Michael, Gabriel and Raphael,

each to bring what he had brought, and give it to Adam.  And they did

so, one by one.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:6
verses.text:
And God commanded Suriyel and Salathiel to bear up Adam and Eve, and

bring them down from the top of the high mountain, and to take them to

the Cave of Treasures.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:7
verses.text:
There they laid the gold on the south side of the cave, the incense

on the eastern side, and the myrrh on the western side.  For the mouth

of the cave was on the north side.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:8
verses.text: The angels then comforted Adam and Eve, and departed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:9
verses.text:
The gold was seventy rods; the incense, twelve pounds; and the

myrrh, three pounds.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:10
verses.text: These remained by Adam in the Cave of Treasures.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:11
verses.text:
God gave these three things to Adam on the third day after he had

come out of the garden, in token of the three days the Lord should

remain in the heart of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 31:12
verses.text:
And these three things, as they continued with Adam in the cave,

gave him light by night; and by day they gave him a little relief from

his sorrow.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:1
verses.text:
And Adam and Eve remained in the Cave of Treasures until the seventh

day; they neither ate of the fruit the earth, nor drank water.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:2
verses.text:
And when it dawned on the eighth day, Adam said to Eve, "O Eve, we

prayed God to give us something from the garden, and He sent his angels

who brought us what we had desired.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:3
verses.text:
But now, get up, let us go to the sea of water we saw at first, and

let us stand in it, praying that God will again be favorable to us and

take us back to the garden; or give us something; or that He will give

us comfort in some other land than this in which we are."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:4
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve came out of the cave, went and stood on the border

of the sea in which they had before thrown themselves, and Adam said to

Eve:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:5
verses.text:
Come, go down into this place, and come not out of it until the end

of thirty days, when I shall come to you.  And pray to God with burning

heart and a sweet voice, to forgive us.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:6
verses.text: And I will go to another place, and go down into it, and do like you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:7
verses.text:
Then Eve went down into the water, as Adam had commanded her.  Adam

also went down into the water; and they stood praying; and besought the

Lord to forgive them their offense, and to restore them to their former

state.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 32:8
verses.text:
And they stood like that praying, until the end of the thirty-five

days.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:1
verses.text:
But Satan, the hater of all good, sought them in the cave, but found

them not, although he searched diligently for them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:2
verses.text:
But he found them standing in the water praying and thought within

himself, "Adam and Eve are standing like that in that water praying to

God to forgive them their transgression, and to restore them to their

former state, and to take them from under my hand.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:3
verses.text:
But I will deceive them so that they shall come out of the water, and

not fulfil their vow."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:4
verses.text:
Then the hater of all good, went not to Adam, but he went to Eve, and

took the form of an angel of God, praising and rejoicing, and said to

her:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:5
verses.text:
"Peace be to you!  Be glad and rejoice!  God is favorable to you, and

He sent me to Adam.  I have brought him the glad tidings of salvation,

and of his being filled with bright light as he was at first.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:6
verses.text:
And Adam, in his joy for his restoration, has sent me to you, that

you come to me, in order that I crown you with light like him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:7
verses.text:
And he said to me, 'Speak to Eve; if she does not come with you, tell

her of the sign when we were on the top of the mountain; how God sent

his angels who took us and brought us to the Cave of Treasures; and

laid the gold on the southern side; incense, on the eastern side; and

myrrh on the western side.'  Now come to him."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:8
verses.text:
When Eve hear these words from him, she rejoiced greatly.  And

thinking Satan's appearance was real, she came out of the sea.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:9
verses.text:
He went before, and she followed him until they came to Adam.  Then

Satan hid himself from her, and she saw him no more.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:10
verses.text:
She then came and stood before Adam, who was standing by the water

and rejoicing in God's forgiveness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:11
verses.text:
And as she called to him, he turned around, found her there and

cried when he saw her, and beat his chest; and from the bitterness of

his grief, he sank into the water.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:12
verses.text:
But God looked at him and at his misery, and at his being about to

breathe his last.  And the Word of God came from heaven, raised him out

of the water, and said to him, "Go up the high bank to Eve."  And when

he came up to Eve he said to her, "Who told you to come here?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:13
verses.text:
Then she told him the discourse of the angel who had appeared to her

and had given her a sign.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:14
verses.text:
But Adam grieved, and gave her to know it was Satan.  He then took

her and they both returned to the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:15
verses.text:
These things happened to them the second time they went down to the

water, seven days after their coming out of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 33:16
verses.text:
They fasted in the water thirty-five days; altogether forty-two days

since they had left the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:1
verses.text:
And on the morning of the forty-third day, they came out of the cave,

sorrowful and crying.  Their bodies were lean, and they were parched

from hunger and thirst, from fasting and praying, and from their heavy

sorrow on account of their transgression.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:2
verses.text:
And when they had come out of the cave they went up the mountain to

the west of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:3
verses.text:
There they stood and prayed and besought God to grant them

forgiveness of their sins.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:4
verses.text:
And after their prayers Adam began to beg God, saying, "O my Lord, my

God, and my Creator, You commanded the four elements to be gathered

together, and they were gathered together by Thine order.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:5
verses.text:
Then You spread Your hand and created me out of one element, that of

dust of the earth; and You brought me into the garden at the third

hour, on a Friday, and informed me of it in the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:6
verses.text:
Then, at first, I knew neither night nor day, for I had a bright

nature; neither did the light in which I lived ever leave me to know

night or day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:7
verses.text:
Then, again, O Lord, in that third hour in which You created me, You

brought to me all beasts, and lions, and ostriches, and fowls of the

air, and all things that move in the earth, which You had created at

the first hour before me of the Friday.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:8
verses.text:
And Your will was that I should name them all, one by one, with a

suitable name.  But You gave me understanding and knowledge, and a pure

heart and a right mind from you, that I should name them after Thine

own mind regarding the naming of them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:9
verses.text:
O God, You made them obedient to me, and ordered that not one of them

break from my sway, according to Your commandment, and to the dominion

which You had given me over them.  But now they are all estranged from

me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:10
verses.text:
Then it was in that third hour of Friday, in which You created me,

and commanded me concerning the tree, to which I was neither to go

near, nor to eat thereof; for You said to me in the garden, 'When you

eat of it, of death you shall die.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:11
verses.text:
And if You had punished me as You said, with death, I should have

died that very moment.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:12
verses.text:
Moreover, when You commanded me regarding the tree, I was neither to

approach nor to eat thereof, Eve was not with me; You had not yet

created her, neither had You yet taken her out of my side; nor had she

yet heard this order from you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:13
verses.text:
Then, at the end of the third hour of that Friday, O Lord, You

caused a slumber and a sleep to come over me, and I slept, and was

overwhelmed in sleep.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:14
verses.text:
Then You drew a rib out of my side, and created it after my own

likeness and image.  Then I awoke; and when I saw her and knew who she

was, I said, 'This is bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh; from now

on she shall be called woman.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:15
verses.text:
It was of Your good will, O God, that You brought a slumber in a

sleep over me, and that You immediately brought Eve out of my side,

until she was out, so that I did not see how she was made; neither

could I witness, O my Lord, how awful and great are Your goodness and

glory.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:16
verses.text:
And of Your goodwill, O Lord, You made us both with bodies of a

bright nature, and You made us two, one; and You gave us Your grace,

and filled us with praises of the Holy Spirit; that we should be

neither hungry nor thirsty, nor know what sorrow is, nor yet faintness

of heart; neither suffering, fasting nor weariness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:17
verses.text:
But now, O God, since we transgressed Your commandment and broke

Your law, You have brought us out into a strange land, and have caused

suffering, and faintness, hunger  and thirst to come over us.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:18
verses.text:
Now, therefore, O God, we pray you, give us something to eat from

the garden, to satisfy our hunger with it; and something wherewith to

quench our thirst.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:19
verses.text:
For, behold, many days, O God, we have tasted nothing and drunk

nothing, and our flesh is dried up, and our strength is wasted, and

sleep is gone from our eyes from faintness and crying.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:20
verses.text:
Then, O God, we dare not gather anything from the fruit of trees,

from fear of you.  For when we transgress at first You spared us and

did not make us die.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:21
verses.text:
But now, we thought in our hearts, if we eat of the fruit of the

trees, without God's order, He will destroy us this time, and will wipe

us off from the face of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:22
verses.text:
And if we drink of this water, without God's order, He will make an

end of us and root us up at once.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:23
verses.text:
Now, therefore, O God, that I am come to this place with Eve, we beg

You to give us some fruit from the garden, that we may be satisfied

with it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 34:24
verses.text:
For we desire the fruit that is on the earth, and all else that we

lack in it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 35:1
verses.text:
Then God looked again at Adam and his crying and groaning, and the

Word of God came to him, and said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 35:2
verses.text:
"O Adam, when you were in My garden, you knew neither eating nor

drinking; neither faintness nor suffering; neither leanness of flesh,

nor change; neither did sleep depart from thine eyes.  But since you

transgressed, and came into this strange land, all these trials are

come over you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:1
verses.text:
Then God commanded the cherub, who kept the gate of the garden with a

sword of fire in his hand, to take some of the fruit of the fig-tree,

and to give it to Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:2
verses.text:
The cherub obeyed the command of the Lord God, and went into the

garden and brought two figs on two twigs, each fig hanging to its leaf;

they were from two of the trees among which Adam and Eve hid themselves

when God went to walk in the garden, and the Word of God came to Adam

and Eve and said to them, "Adam, Adam, where are you?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:3
verses.text:
And Adam answered, "O God, here I am.  When I heard the sound of You

and Your voice, I hid myself, because I am naked."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:4
verses.text:
Then the cherub took two figs and brought them to Adam and Eve.  But

he threw them to them from a distance; for they might not come near the

cherub by reason of their flesh, that could not come near the fire.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:5
verses.text:
At first, angels trembled at the presence of Adam and were afraid of

him.  But now Adam trembled before the angels and was afraid of them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:6
verses.text:
Then Adam came closer and took one fig, and Eve also came in turn and

took the other.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 36:7
verses.text:
And as they took them up in their hands, they looked at them, and

knew they were from the trees among which they had hidden themselves.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:1
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "Do you not see these figs and their leaves,

with which we covered ourselves when we were stripped of our bright

nature?  But now, we do not know what misery and suffering may come

over us from eating them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:2
verses.text:
Now, therefore, O Eve, let us restrain ourselves and not eat of them,

you and I; and let us ask God to give us of the fruit of the Tree of

Life."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:3
verses.text:
Thus did Adam and Eve restrain themselves, and did not eat of these

figs.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:4
verses.text:
But Adam began to pray to God and to beseech Him to give him of the

fruit of the Tree of Life, saying thus: "O God, when we transgressed

Your commandment at the sixth hour of Friday, we were stripped of the

bright nature we had, and did not continue in the garden after our

transgression, more than three hours.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:5
verses.text:
But in the evening You made us come out of it.  O God, we

transgressed against You one hour, and all these trials and sorrows

have come over us until this day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:6
verses.text:
And those days together with this the forty-third day, do not redeem

that one hour in which we transgressed!

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:7
verses.text:
O God, look at us with an eye of pity, and do not avenge us according

to our transgression of Your commandment, in Your presence.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:8
verses.text:
O God, give us of the fruit of the Tree of Life, that we may eat of

it, and live, and turn not to see sufferings and other trouble, in this

earth; for You are God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:9
verses.text:
When we transgressed Your commandment, You made us come out of the

garden, and sent a cherub to keep the Tree of Life, lest we should eat

thereof, and live; and know nothing of faintness after we transgressed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 37:10
verses.text:
But now, O Lord, behold, we have endured all these days, and have

borne sufferings.  Make these forty-three days an equivalent for the

one hour in which we transgressed."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 38:1
verses.text: After these things the Word of God came to Adam, and said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 38:2
verses.text:
"O Adam, as to the fruit on the Tree of Life that you have asked for,

I will not give it to you now, but only when the 5500 years are

fulfilled.  At that time I will give you fruit from the Tree of Life,

and you will eat, and live forever, you, and Eve, and your righteous

descendants.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 38:3
verses.text:
But these forty-three days cannot make amends for the hour in which

you transgressed My commandment.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 38:4
verses.text:
O Adam, I gave you the fruit of the fig-tree to eat in which you hid

yourself.  Go and eat of it, you and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 38:5
1 Adam and Eve 38:6
verses.text: And God withdrew His Word from Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 39:1
verses.text:
Then Adam returned to Eve, and said to her, "Get up, and take a fig

for yourself, and I will take another; and let us go to our cave."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 39:2
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve took each a fig and went towards the cave; the time

was about the setting of the sun; and their thoughts made them long to

eat of the fruit.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 39:3
verses.text:
But Adam said to Eve, "I am afraid to eat of this fig.  I know not

what may come over me from it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 39:4
verses.text:
So Adam cried, and stood praying before God, saying, "Satisfy my

hunger, without my having to eat this fig; for after I have eaten it,

what will it profit me?  And what shall I desire and ask of you, O God,

when it is gone?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 39:5
verses.text:
And he said again, "I am afraid to eat of it; for I know not what

will befall me through it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 40:1
verses.text:
Then the Word of God came to Adam, and said to him, "O Adam, why

didn't you have this dread, or this fasting, or this care before now?

And why didn't you have this fear before you transgressed?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 40:2
verses.text:
But when you came to live in this strange land, your animal body

could not survive on earth without earthly food, to strengthen it and

to restore its powers."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 40:3
verses.text: And God withdrew His Word for Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:1
verses.text:
Then Adam took the fig, and laid it on the golden rods.  Eve also

took her fig, and put it on the incense.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:2
verses.text:
And the weight of each fig was that of a water-melon; for the fruit

of the garden was much larger than the fruit of this land.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:3
verses.text:
But Adam and Eve remained standing and fasting the whole of that

night, until the morning dawned.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:4
verses.text:
When the sun rose they were still praying, but after they had

finished praying, Adam said to Eve:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:5
verses.text:
"O Eve, come, let us go to the border of the garden looking south; to

the place from where the river flows, and is parted into four heads.

There we will pray to God, and ask Him to give us some of the Water of

Life to drink.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:6
verses.text:
For God has not fed us with the Tree of Life, in order that we may
