not live.  Therefore, we will ask him to give us some of the Water of

Life, and to quench our thirst with it, rather than with a drink of

water of this land."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:7
verses.text:
When Eve heard these words from Adam, she agreed; and they both got

up and came to the southern border of the garden, at the edge of the

river of water a short distance from the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:8
verses.text:
And they stood and prayed before the Lord, and asked Him to look at

them this once, to forgive them, and to grant them their request.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:9
verses.text:
After this prayer from both of them, Adam began to pray with his

voice before God, and said;--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:10
verses.text:
"O Lord, when I was in the garden and saw the water that flowed from

under the Tree of Life, my heart did not desire, neither did my body

require to drink of it; neither did I know thirst, for I was living;

and above that which I am now.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:11
verses.text:
So that in order to live I did not require any Food of Life, neither

did I drink of the Water of Life.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:12
verses.text:
But now, O God, I am dead; my flesh is parched with thirst.  Give me

of the Water of Life that I may drink of it and live.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 41:13
verses.text:
Of Your mercy, O God, save me from these plagues and trials, and

bring me into another land different from this, if You will not let me

live in Your garden."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:1
verses.text: Then came the Word of God to Adam, and said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:2
verses.text:
"O Adam, as to what you said, 'Bring me into a land where there is

rest,' it is not another land than this, but it is the kingdom of

heaven where alone there is rest.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:3
verses.text:
But you can not make your entrance into it at present; but only after

your judgment is past and fulfilled.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:4
verses.text:
Then will I make you go up into the kingdom of heaven, you and your

righteous descendants; and I will give you and them the rest you ask

for at present.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:5
verses.text:
And if you said, 'Give me of the Water of Life that I may drink and

live'--it cannot be this day, but on the day that I shall descend into

hell, and break the gates of brass, and bruise in pieces the kingdoms

of iron.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:6
verses.text:
Then will I in mercy save your soul and the souls of the righteous,

to give them rest in My garden.  And that shall be when the end of the

world is come.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:7
verses.text:
And, again, in regards to the Water of Life you seek, it will not be

granted you this day; but on the day that I shall shed My blood on your

head in the land of Golgotha.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:8
verses.text:
For My blood shall be the Water of Life to you at that time, and not

to just you alone, but to all your descendants who shall believe in

Me; that it be to them for rest forever."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:9
verses.text:
The Lord said again to Adam, "O Adam, when you were in the garden,

these trials did not come to you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:10
verses.text:
But since you transgressed My commandment, all these sufferings have

come over you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:11
verses.text:
Now, also, does your flesh require food and drink; drink then of

that water that flows by you on the face of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:12
verses.text: Then God withdrew His Word from Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 42:13
verses.text:
And Adam and Eve worshipped the Lord, and returned from the river of

water to the cave.  It was noon-day; and when they drew near to the

cave, they saw a large fire by it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:1
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve were afraid, and stood still.  And Adam said to

Eve, "What is that fire by our cave?  We have done nothing in it to

cause this fire.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:2
verses.text:
We neither have bread to bake therein, nor broth to cook there.  As

to this fire, we have never known anything like it, neither do we know

what to call it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:3
verses.text:
But ever since God sent the cherub with a sword of fire that flashed

and lightened in his hand, from fear of which we fell down and were

like corpses, have we not seen the like.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:4
verses.text:
But now, O Eve, behold, this is the same fire that was in the

cherub's hand, which God has sent to keep the cave in which we live.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:5
verses.text: O Eve, it is because God is angry with us, and will drive us from it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:6
verses.text:
O Eve, we have again transgressed His commandment in that cave, so

that He had sent this fire to burn around it, and to prevent us from

going into it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:7
verses.text:
If this be really so, O Eve, where shall we live?  And where shall we

flee from before the face of the Lord?  Since, in regards to the

garden, He will not let us live in it, and He has deprived us of the

good things thereof; but He has placed us in this cave, in which we

have borne darkness, trials and hardships, until at last we have found

comfort therein.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:8
verses.text:
But now that He has brought us out into another land, who knows what

may happen in it?  And who knows but that the darkness of that land may

be far greater than the darkness of this land?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:9
verses.text:
Who knows what may happen in that land by day or by night? And who

knows whether it will be far or near, O Eve?  Where it will please God

to put us, may be far from the garden, O Eve?  Or where God will

prevent us from beholding Him, because we have transgressed His

commandment, and because we have made requests of Him at all times?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:10
verses.text:
O Eve, if God will bring us into a strange land other than this, in

which we find consolation, it must be to put our souls to death, and

blot out our name from the face of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:11
verses.text:
O Eve, if we are further alienated from the garden and from God,

where shall we find Him again, and ask Him to give us gold, incense,

myrrh, and some fruit of the fig-tree?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:12
verses.text:
Where shall we find Him, to comfort us a second time?  Where shall

we find Him, that He may think of us, as regards the covenant He has

made on our behalf?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:13
verses.text:
Then Adam said no more. And they kept looking, He and Eve, towards

the cave, and at the fire that flared up around it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:14
verses.text:
But that fire was from Satan.  For he had gathered trees and dry

grasses, and had carried and brought them to the cave, and had set fire

to them, in order to consume the cave and what was in it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:15
verses.text:
So that Adam and Eve should be left in sorrow, and he should cut off

their trust in God, and make them deny Him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:16
verses.text:
But by the mercy of God he could not burn the cave, for God sent His

angel around the cave to guard it from such a fire, until it went out.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 43:17
verses.text:
And this fire lasted from noon-day until the break of day.  That was

the forty-fifth day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:1
verses.text:
Yet Adam and Eve were standing and looking at the fire, and unable to

come near the cave from their dread of the fire.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:2
verses.text:
And Satan kept on bringing trees and throwing them into the fire,

until the flames of the fire rose up on high, and covered the whole

cave, thinking, as he did in his own mind, to consume the cave with

much fire.  But the angel of the Lord was guarding it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:3
verses.text:
And yet he could not curse Satan, nor injure him by word, because he

had no authority over him, neither did he take to doing so with words

from his mouth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:4
verses.text:
Therefore the angel tolerated him, without saying one bad word, until

the Word of God came who said to Satan, "Go away from here; once before

you deceived My servants, and this time you seek to destroy them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:5
verses.text:
Were it not for My mercy I would have destroyed you and your hosts

from off the earth. But I have had patience with you, until the end of

the world."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:6
verses.text:
Then Satan fled from before the Lord.  But the fire went on burning

around the cave like a coal-fire the whole day; which was the

forty-sixth day Adam and Eve had spent since they came out of the

garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:7
verses.text:
And when Adam and Eve saw that the heat of the fire had somewhat

cooled down, they began to walk towards the cave to get into it as they

usually did; but they could not, by reason of the heat of the fire.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:8
verses.text:
Then they both began crying because of the fire that separated them

from the cave, and that came towards them, burning.  And they were

afraid.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 44:9
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "See this fire of which we have a portion in

us:  which formerly yielded to us, but no longer does so, now that we

have transgressed the limit of creation, and changed our condition, and

our nature is altered.  But the fire is not changed in its nature, nor

altered from its creation.  Therefore it now has power over us; and

when we come near it, it scorches our flesh."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:1
verses.text:
Then Adam rose and prayed to God, saying, "See, this fire has

separated us from the cave in which You have commanded us to live; but

now, behold, we cannot go into it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:2
verses.text: Then God heard Adam, and sent him His Word, that said:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:3
verses.text:
"O Adam, see this fire!  How different the flame and heat thereof are

from the garden of delights and the good things in it!

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:4
verses.text:
When you were under My control, all creatures yielded to you; but

after you have transgressed My commandment, they all rise over you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:5
verses.text:
God said again to him, "See, O Adam, how Satan has exalted you!  He

has deprived you of the Godhead, and of an exalted state like Me, and

has not kept his word to you; but has, after all, become your enemy.

He is the one who made this fire in which he meant to burn you and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:6
verses.text:
Why, O Adam, has he not kept his agreement with you, not even one

day; but has deprived you of the glory that was on you--when you

yielded to his command?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:7
verses.text:
Do you think, Adam, that he loved you when he made this agreement

with you?  Or that he loved you and wished to raise you on high?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:8
verses.text:
But no, Adam, he did not do all that out of love to you; but he

wished to make you come out of light into darkness; and from an exalted

state to degradation; from glory to abasement; from joy to sorrow; and

from rest to fasting and fainting."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:9
verses.text:
God also said to Adam, "See this fire kindled by Satan around your

cave; see this wonder that surrounds you; and know that it will

encompass about both you and your descendants, when you obey his

command; that he will plague you with fire; and that you will go down

into hell after you are dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:10
verses.text:
Then you will see the burning of his fire, that will be burning

around you and likewise your descendants.  You will not be delivered

from it until My coming; just like you cannot go into your cave right

now because of the great fire around it; not until My Word comes and

makes a way for you on the day My covenant is fulfilled.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:11
verses.text:
There is no way for you at present to come from this life to rest,

not until My Word comes, who is My Word.  Then He will make a way for

you, and you shall have rest." Then God called with His Word to the

fire that burned around the cave, that it split itself in half, until

Adam had gone through it.  Then the fire parted itself by God's order,

and a way was made for Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 45:12
verses.text: And God withdrew His Word from Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:1
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve began again to come into the cave.  And when they

came to the way between the fire, Satan blew into the fire like a

whirlwind, and caused the burning coal-fire to cover Adam and Eve; so

that their bodies were singed; and the coal-fire scorched them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:2
verses.text:
And from the burning of the fire Adam and Eve screamed, and said, "O

Lord, save us!  Leave us not to be consumed and plagued by this burning

fire; neither require us for having transgressed Your commandment."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:3
verses.text:
Then God looked at their bodies, on which Satan had caused fire to

burn, and God sent His angel that stayed the burning fire.  But the

wounds remained on their bodies.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:4
verses.text:
And God said to Adam, "See Satan's love for you, who pretended to

give you the Godhead and greatness; and, behold, he burns you with

fire, and seeks to destroy you from off the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:5
verses.text:
Then look at Me, O Adam; I created you, and how many times have I

delivered you out of his hand?  If not, wouldn't  he have destroyed

you?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:6
verses.text:
God said again to Eve, "What is that he promised you in the garden,

saying, 'As soon as you eat from the tree, your eyes will be opened,

and you shall become like gods, knowing good and evil.'  But look!  He

has burnt your bodies with fire, and has made you taste the taste of

fire, for the taste of the garden; and has made you see the burning of

fire, and the evil of it, and the power it has over you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:7
verses.text:
Your eyes have seen the good he has taken from you, and in truth he

has opened your eyes; and you have seen the garden in which you were

with Me, and you have also seen the evil that has come over you from

Satan.  But as to the Godhead he cannot give it to you, neither fulfil

his speech to you.  No, he was bitter against you and your descendants,

that will come after you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 46:8
verses.text: And God withdrew His Word form them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:1
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve came into the cave, yet trembling at the fire that

had scorched their bodies.  So Adam said to Eve:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:2
verses.text:
"Look, the fire has burnt our flesh in this world; but how will it be

when we are dead, and Satan shall punish our souls?  Is not our

deliverance long and far off, unless God come, and in mercy to us

fulfil His promise?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:3
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve passed into the cave, blessing themselves for

coming into it once more.  For it was in their thoughts, that they

never should enter it, when they saw the fire around it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:4
verses.text:
But as the sun was setting the fire was still burning and nearing

Adam and Eve in the cave, so that they could not sleep in it.  After

the sun had set, they went out of it.  This was the forty-seventh day

after they came out of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:5
verses.text:
Adam and Eve then came under the top of hill by the garden to sleep,

as they were accustomed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:6
verses.text:
And they stood and prayed God to forgive them their sins, and then

fell asleep under the summit of the mountain.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:7
verses.text:
But Satan, the hater of all good, thought within himself: "Whereas

God has promised salvation to Adam by covenant, and that He would

deliver him out of all the hardships that have befallen him--but has

not promised me by covenant, and will not deliver me out of my

hardships; no, since He has promised him that He should make him and

his descendants live in the kingdom in which I once was--I will kill

Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 47:8
verses.text:
The earth shall be rid of him; and shall be left to me alone; so that

when he is dead he may not have any descendants left to inherit the

kingdom that shall remain my own realm; God will then be wanting me,

and He will restore it to me and my hosts."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:1
verses.text:
After this Satan called to his hosts, all of which came to him, and

said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:2
verses.text: "O, our lord, what will you do?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:3
verses.text:
He then said to them, "You know that this Adam, whom God created out

of the dust, is the one who has taken our kingdom, come, let us gather

together and kill him; or hurl a rock at him and at Eve, and crush them

under it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:4
verses.text:
When Satan's hosts heard these words, they came to the part of the

mountain where Adam and Eve were asleep.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:5
verses.text:
Then Satan and his host took a huge rock, broad and even, and without

blemish, thinking within himself, "If there should be a hole in the

rock, when it fell on them, the hole in the rock might come over them,

and so they would escape and not die."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:6
verses.text:
He then said to his hosts, "Take up this stone, and throw it flat on

them, so that it doesn't roll off them to somewhere else.  And when you

have hurled it, get away from there quickly."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:7
verses.text:
And they did as he told them.  But as the rock fell down from the

mountain toward Adam and Eve, God commanded the rock to become a dome

over them, that did them no harm.  And so it was by God's order.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:8
verses.text:
But when the rock fell, the whole earth quaked with it, and was

shaken from the size of the rock.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:9
verses.text:
And as it quaked and shook, Adam and Eve awoke from sleep, and found

themselves under a dome of rock.  But they didn't know what had

happened; because when the fell asleep they were under the sky, and not

under a dome; and when they saw it, they were afraid.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:10
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "Wherefore has the mountain bent itself, and

the earth quaked and shaken on our account?  And why has this rock

spread itself over us like a tent?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:11
verses.text:
Does God intend to plague us and to shut us up in this prison? Or

will He close the earth over us?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:12
verses.text:
He is angry with us for our having come out of the cave, without His

order; and for our having done so of our own accord, without consulting

Him, when we left the cave and came to this place."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:13
verses.text:
Then Eve said, "If, indeed, the earth quaked for our sake, and this

rock forms a tent over us because of our transgression, then we will be

sorry, O Adam, because our punishment will be long.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:14
verses.text:
But get up and pray to God to let us know concerning this, and what

this rock is that is spread over us like a tent."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 48:15
verses.text:
Then Adam stood up and prayed before the Lord, to let him know what

had brought about this difficult time.  And Adam stood praying like

that until the morning.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:1
verses.text: Then the Word of God came and said:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:2
verses.text:
"O Adam, who counselled you, when you came out of the cave, to come

to this place?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:3
verses.text:
And Adam said to God, "O Lord, we came to this place because of the

heat of the fire, that came over us inside the cave."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:4
verses.text:
Then the Lord God said to Adam, "O Adam, you dread the heat of fire

for one night, but how will it be when you live in hell?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:5
verses.text:
Yet, O Adam, don't be afraid, and don't believe that I have placed

this dome of rock over you to plague you with it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:6
verses.text:
It came from Satan, who had promised you the Godhead and majesty.  It

is he who threw down this rock to kill you under it, and Eve with you,

and thus to prevent you from living on the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:7
verses.text:
But, in mercy for you, just as that rock was falling down on you, I

commanded it to form an dome over you; and the rock under you to lower

itself.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:8
verses.text:
And this sign, O Adam, will happen to Me at My coming on earth: Satan

will raise the people of the Jews to put Me to death; and they will lay

Me in a rock, and seal a large stone over Me, and I shall remain within

that rock three days and three nights.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:9
verses.text:
But on the third day I shall rise again, and it shall be salvation to

you, O Adam, and to your descendants, to believe in Me.  But, O Adam, I

will not bring you from under this rock until three days and three

nights have passed."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:10
verses.text: And God withdrew His Word from Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:11
verses.text:
But Adam and Eve lived under the rock three days and three nights,

as God had told them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:12
verses.text:
And God did so to them because they had left their cave and had come

to  this same place without God's order.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 49:13
verses.text:
But, after three days and three nights, God created an opening in

the dome of rock and allowed them to get out from under it.  Their

flesh was dried up, and their eyes and hearts were troubled from crying

and sorrow.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:1
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve went forth and came into the Cave of Treasures, and

they stood praying in it the whole of that day, until the evening.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:2
verses.text:
And this took place at the end of the fifty days after they had left

the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:3
verses.text:
But Adam and Eve rose again and prayed to God in the cave the whole

of that night, and begged for mercy from Him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:4
verses.text:
And when the day dawned, Adam said to Eve, "Come!  Let us go and do

some work for our bodies."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:5
verses.text:
So they went out of the cave, and came to the northern border of the

garden, and they looked for something to cover their bodies with.  But

they found nothing, and knew not how to do the work.  Yet their bodies

were stained, and they were speechless from cold and heat.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:6
verses.text:
Then Adam stood and asked God to show him something with which to

cover their bodies.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 50:7
verses.text:
Then came the Word of God and said to him, "O Adam, take Eve and come

to the seashore where you fasted before.  There you will find skins of

sheep that were left after lions ate the carcasses.  Take them and make

garments for yourselves, and clothe yourselves with them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:1
verses.text:
When Adam heard these words from God, he took Eve and went from the

northern end of the garden to the south of it, by the river of water

where they once fasted.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:2
verses.text:
But as they were going on their way, and before they got there,

Satan, the wicked one, had heard the Word of God communing with Adam

respecting his covering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:3
verses.text:
It grieved him, and he hastened to the place where the sheep-skins

were, with the intention of taking them and throwing them into the sea,

or of burning them with fire, so that Adam and Eve would not find them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:4
verses.text:
But as he was about to take them, the Word of God came from heaven,

and bound him by the side of those skins until Adam and Eve came near

him.  But as they got closer to him they were afraid of him, and of his

hideous look.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:5
verses.text:
Then came the Word of God to Adam and Eve, and said to them, "This is

he who was hidden in the serpent, and who deceived you, and stripped

you of the garment of light and glory in which you were.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:6
verses.text:
This is he who promised you majesty and divinity.  Where, then, is

the beauty that was on him?  Where is his divinity?  Where is his

light?  Where is the glory that rested on him?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:7
verses.text:
Now his figure is hideous; he is become abominable among angels; and

he has come to be called Satan.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:8
verses.text:
O Adam, he wished to take from you this earthly garment of

sheep-skins, and to destroy it, and not let you be covered with it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:9
verses.text:
What, then, is his beauty that you should have followed him?  And

what have you gained by obeying him?  See his evil works and then look

at Me; at Me, your Creator, and at the good deeds I do you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:10
verses.text:
See, I bound him until you came and saw him and beheld his weakness,

that no power is left with him."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 51:11
verses.text: And God released him from his bonds.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:1
verses.text:
After this Adam and Eve said no more, but cried before God on account

of their creation, and of their bodies that required an earthly

covering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:2
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "O Eve, this is the skin of beasts with which

we shall be covered,  but when we put it on, behold, we shall be

wearing a token of death on our bodies. Just  as the owners of these

skins have died and have wasted away,  so also shall we die and pass

away."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:3
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve took the skins, and went back to the Cave of

Treasures; and when in it, they stood and prayed as they were

accustomed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:4
verses.text:
And they thought how they could make garments of those skins; for

they had no skill for it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:5
verses.text:
Then God sent to them His angel to show them how to work it out.  And

the angel said to Adam, "Go forth, and bring some palm-thorns."  Then

Adam went out, and brought some, as the angel had commanded him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:6
verses.text:
Then the angel began before them to work out the skins, after the

manner of one who prepares a shirt.  And he took the thorns and stuck

them into the skins, before their eyes.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:7
verses.text:
Then the angel again stood up and prayed God that the thorns in those

skins should be hidden, so as to be, as it were, sewn with one thread.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:8
verses.text:
And so it was, by God's order; they became garments for Adam and Eve,

and He clothed them therewith.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:9
verses.text:
From that time the nakedness of their bodies was covered from the

sight of each other's eyes.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:10
verses.text: And this happened at the end of the fifty-first day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:11
verses.text:
Then when Adam's and Eve's bodies were covered, they stood and

prayed, and sought mercy of the Lord, and forgiveness, and gave Him

thanks for that He had had mercy on them, and had covered their

nakedness.  And they ceased not from prayer the whole of that night.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:12
verses.text:
Then when the morning dawned at the rising of the sun, they said

their prayers after their custom; and then went out of the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 52:13
verses.text:
And Adam said to Eve, "Since we don't know what there is to the west

of this cave, let us go out and see it today." Then they came forth and

went toward the western border.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:1
verses.text:
They were not very far from the cave, when Satan came towards them,

and hid himself between them and the cave, under the form of two

ravenous lions three days without food, that came towards Adam and Eve,

as if to break them in pieces and devour them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:2
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve cried, and prayed God to deliver them from their

paws.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:3
verses.text: Then the Word of God came to them, and drove away the lions from them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:4
verses.text:
And God said to Adam, "O Adam, what do you seek on the western

border?  And why have you left of thine own accord the eastern border,

in which was your living place?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:5
verses.text:
Now then, turn back to your cave, and remain in it, so that Satan

won't deceive you or work his purpose over you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:6
verses.text:
For in this western border, O Adam, there will go from you a

descendant, that shall replenish it; and that will defile themselves

with their sins, and with their yielding to the commands of Satan, and

by following his works.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:7
verses.text:
Therefore will I bring over them the waters of a flood, and overwhelm

them all.  But I will deliver what is left of the righteous among them;

and I will bring them to a distant land, and the land in which you live

now shall remain desolate and without one inhabitant in it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 53:8
verses.text:
After God had thus spoken to them, they went back to the Cave of

Treasures.  But their flesh was dried up, and they were weak from

fasting and praying, and from the sorrow they felt at having trespassed

against God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:1
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve stood up in the cave and prayed the whole of that

night until the morning dawned.  And when the sun was risen they both

went out of the cave; their heads were wandering from heaviness of

sorrow and they didn't know where they were going.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:2
verses.text:
And they walked in that condition to the southern border of the

garden.  And they began to go up that border until they came to the

eastern border beyond which there was no more land.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:3
verses.text:
And the cherub who guarded the garden was standing at the western

gate, and guarding it against Adam and Eve, lest they should suddenly

come into the garden.  And the cherub turned around, as if to put them

to death; according to the commandment God had given him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:4
verses.text:
When Adam and Eve came to the eastern border of the garden--thinking

in their hearts that the cherub was not watching--as they were standing

by the gate as if wishing to go in, suddenly came the cherub with a

flashing sword of fire in his hand; and when he saw them, he went forth

to kill them.  For he was afraid that God would destroy him if they

went into the garden without His order.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:5
verses.text:
And the sword of the cherub seemed to shoot flames a distance away

from it.  But when he raised it over Adam and Eve, the flame of the

sword did not flash forth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:6
verses.text:
Therefore the cherub thought that God was favorable to them, and was

bringing them back into the garden.  And the cherub stood wondering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:7
verses.text:
He could not go up to Heaven to determine God's order regarding their

getting into the garden; he therefore continued to stand by them,

unable as he was to part from them; for he was afraid that if  they

should enter the garden without permission, God would destroy him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:8
verses.text:
When Adam and Eve saw the cherub coming towards them with a flaming

sword of fire in his hand, they fell on their faces from fear, and were

as dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:9
verses.text:
At that time the heavens and the earth shook; and another cherubim

came down from heaven to the cherub who guarded the garden, and saw him

amazed and silent.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:10
verses.text:
Then, again, other angels came down close to the place where Adam

and Eve were.  They were divided between joy and sorrow.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:11
verses.text:
They were glad, because they thought that God was favorable to Adam,

and wished him to return to the garden; and wished to restore him to

the gladness he once enjoyed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 54:12
verses.text:
But they sorrowed over Adam, because he was fallen like a dead man,

he and Eve; and they said in their thoughts, "Adam has not died in this

place; but God has put him to death, for his having come to this place,

and wishing to get into the garden without His permission."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:1
verses.text:
Then came the Word of God to Adam and Eve, and raised them from their

dead state, saying to them, "Why did you come up here?  Do you intend

to go into the garden, from which I brought you out?  It cannot be

today; but only when the covenant I have made with you is fulfilled."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:2
verses.text:
Then Adam, when he heard the Word of God, and the fluttering of the

angels whom he did not see, but only heard the sound of them with his

ears, he and Eve cried, and said to the angels:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:3
verses.text:
"O Spirits, who wait on God, look at me, and at my being unable to

see you!  For when I was in my former bright nature, then I could see

you.  I sang praises as you do; and my heart was far above you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:4
verses.text:
But now, that I have transgressed, that bright nature is gone from

me, and I am come to this miserable state.  And now I have come to

this, that I cannot see you, and you do not serve me like you used to

do.  For I have become animal flesh.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:5
verses.text:
Yet now, O angels of God, ask God with me, to restore me to that

wherein I was formerly; to rescue me from this misery, and to remove

from me the sentence of death He passed on me, for having trespassed

against Him."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:6
verses.text:
Then, when the angels heard these words, they all grieved over him;

and cursed Satan who had misled Adam, until he came from the garden to

misery; from life to death; from peace to trouble; and from gladness to

a strange land.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:7
verses.text:
Then the angels said to Adam, "You obeyed Satan, and ignored the Word

of God who created you; and you believed that Satan would fulfil all he

had promised you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:8
verses.text:
But now, O Adam, we will make known to you, what came over us though

him, before his fall from heaven.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:9
verses.text:
He gathered together his hosts, and deceived them, promising to give

them a great kingdom, a divine nature; and other promises he made them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:10
verses.text:
His hosts believed that his word was true, so they yielded to him,

and renounced the glory of God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:11
verses.text:
He then sent for us--according to the orders in which we were--to

come under his command, and to accept his vein promise.  But we would

not, and we did not take his advice.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:12
verses.text:
Then after he had fought with God, and had dealt forwardly with Him,

he gathered together his hosts, and made war with us.  And if it had

not been for God's strength that was with us, we could not have

prevailed against him to hurl him from heaven.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:13
verses.text:
But when he fell from among us, there was great joy in heaven,

because of his going down from us.  For if he had remained in heaven,

nothing, not even one angel would have remained in it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:14
verses.text:
But God in His mercy, drove him from among us to this dark earth;

for he had become darkness itself and a worker of unrighteousness.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:15
verses.text:
And he has continued, O Adam, to make war against you, until he

tricked you and made you come out of the garden, to this strange land,

where all these trials have come to you.  And death, which God brought

to him, he has also brought to you, O Adam, because you obeyed him, and

trespassed against God."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 55:16
verses.text:
Then all the angels rejoiced and praised God, and asked Him not to

destroy Adam this time, for his having sought to enter the garden; but

to bear with him until the fulfillment of the promise; and to help him

in this world until he was free from Satan's hand.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:1
verses.text: Then came the Word of God to Adam, and said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:2
verses.text:
"O Adam, look at that garden of joy and at this earth of toil, and

behold the garden is full of angels, but look at yourself alone on this

earth with Satan whom you obeyed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:3
verses.text:
Yet, if you had submitted, and been obedient to Me, and had kept My

Word, you would be with My angels in My garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:4
verses.text:
But when you transgressed and obeyed Satan, you became his guests

among his angels, that are full of wickedness; and you came to this

earth, that brings forth to you thorns and thistles.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:5
verses.text:
O Adam, ask him who deceived you, to give you the divine nature he

promised you, or to make you a garden as I had made for you; or to fill

you with that same bright nature with which I had filled you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:6
verses.text:
Ask him to make you a body like the one I made you, or to give you a

day of rest as I gave you; or to create within you a reasonable soul,

as I created for you; or to take you from here to some other earth than

this one which I gave you.  But, O Adam, he will not fulfil even one of

the things he told you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:7
verses.text:
Acknowledge, then, My favor towards you, and My mercy on you, My

creature; that I have not avenged you for your transgression against

Me, but in My pity for you I have promised you that at the end of the

great five and a half days I will come and save you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:8
verses.text:
Then God said again to Adam and Eve, "Get up, go down from here,

before the cherub with a sword of fire in his hand destroys you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:9
verses.text:
But Adam's heart was comforted by God's words to him, and he

worshipped before Him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:10
verses.text:
And God commanded His angels to escort Adam and Eve to the cave with

joy, instead of the fear that had come over them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:11
verses.text:
Then the angels took up Adam and Eve, and brought them down from the

mountain by the garden, with songs and psalms, until they arrived at

the cave.  There the angels began to comfort and to strengthen them,

and then departed from them towards heaven, to their Creator, who had

sent them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:12
verses.text:
But after the angels had departed from Adam and Eve, Satan came with

shamefacedness, and stood at the entrance of the cave in which were

Adam and Eve.  He then called to Adam, and said, "O Adam, come, let me

speak to you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 56:13
verses.text:
Then Adam came out of the cave, thinking he was one of God's angels

that was come to give him some good counsel.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:1
verses.text:
But when Adam came out and saw his hideous figure, he was afraid of

him, and said to him, "Who are you?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:2
verses.text:
Then Satan answered and said to him, "It is I, who hid myself within

the serpent, and who spoke to Eve, and who enticed her until she obeyed

my command.  I am he who sent her, using my deceitful speech, to

deceive you,  until you both ate of the fruit of the tree and abandoned

the command of God."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:3
verses.text:
But when Adam heard these words from him, he said to him, "Can you

make me a garden as God made for me?  Or can you clothe me in the same

bright nature in which God had clothed me?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:4
verses.text:
Where is the divine nature you promised to give me?  Where is that

slick speech of yours that you had with us at first, when we were in

the garden?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:5
verses.text:
Then Satan said to Adam, "Do you think that when I have promised one

something that I would actually deliver it to him or fulfil my word?

Of course not.  For I myself have never even thought of obtaining what

I promised.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:6
verses.text:
Therefore I fell, and I made you fall by that for which I myself

fell; and with you also, whosoever accepts my counsel, falls thereby.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:7
verses.text:
But now, O Adam, because you fell you are under my rule, and I am

king over you; because you have obeyed me and have transgressed against

your God.  Neither will there be any deliverance from my hands until

the day promised you by your God."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:8
verses.text:
Again he said, "Because we do not know the day agreed on with you by

your God, nor the hour in which you shall be delivered, for that reason

we will multiply war and murder on you and your descendants after you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:9
verses.text:
This is our will and our good pleasure, that we may not leave one of

the sons of men to inherit our orders in heaven.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:10
verses.text:
For as to our home, O Adam, it is in burning fire; and we will not

stop our evil doing, no, not one day nor one hour.  And I, O Adam,

shall set you on fire when you come into the cave to live there."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:11
verses.text:
When Adam heard these words he cried and mourned, and said to Eve,

"Hear what he said; that he won't fulfil any of what he told you in the

garden.  Did he really then become king over us?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 57:12
verses.text: But we will ask God, who created us, to deliver us out of his hands."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 58:1
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve spread their hands before God, praying and begging

Him to drive Satan away from them so that he can't harm them or force

them to deny God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 58:2
verses.text:
Then God sent to them at once, His angel, who drove away Satan from

them.  This happened about sunset, on the fifty-third day after they

had come out of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 58:3
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve went into the cave, and stood up and turned their

faces to the ground, to pray to God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 58:4
verses.text:
But before they prayed Adam said to Eve, "Look, you have seen what

temptations have befallen us in this land.  Come, let us get up, and

ask God to forgive us the sins we have committed; and we will not come

out until the end of the day next to the fortieth.  And if we die in

here, He will save us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 58:5
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve got up, and joined together in entreating God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 58:6
verses.text:
They continued praying like this in the cave; neither did they come

out of it, by night or by day, until their prayers went up out of their

mouths, like a flame of fire.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:1
verses.text:
But Satan, the hater of all good, did not allow them to finish their

prayers.  For he called to his hosts, and they came, all of them.  Then

he said to them, "Since Adam and Eve, whom we deceived, have agreed

together to pray to God night and day, and to beg Him to deliver them,

and since they will not come out of the cave until the end of the

fortieth day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:2
verses.text:
And since they will continue their prayers as they have both agreed

to do, that He will deliver them out of our hands, and restore them to

their former state, see what we shall do to them."  And his hosts said

to him, "Power is thine, O our lord, to do what you list."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:3
verses.text:
Then Satan, great in wickedness, took his hosts and came into the

cave, in the thirtieth night of the forty days and one; and he beat

Adam and Eve, until he left them dead.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:4
verses.text:
Then came the Word of God to Adam and Eve, who raised them from their

suffering, and God said to Adam, "Be strong, and be not afraid of him

who has just come to you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:5
1 Adam and Eve 59:6
verses.text:
Then God said to him, "O Adam, see, he is lord and master of all you

have, he who said, he would give you divinity.  Where is this love for

you?  And where is the gift he promised?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:7
verses.text:
Did it please him just once, O Adam, to come to you, comfort you,

strengthen you, rejoice with you, or send his hosts to protect you;

because you have obeyed him, and have yielded to his counsel; and have

followed his commandment and transgressed Mine?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:8
verses.text:
Then Adam cried before the Lord, and said, "O Lord because I

transgressed a little, You have severely punished me in return for it,

I ask You to deliver me out of his hands; or else have pity on me, and

take my soul out of my body now in this strange land."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:9
verses.text:
Then God said to Adam, "If only there had been this sighing and

praying before, before you transgressed!  Then would you have rest from

the trouble in which you are now."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:10
verses.text:
But God had patience with Adam, and let him and Eve remain in the

cave until they had fulfilled the forty days.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 59:11
verses.text:
But as to Adam and Eve, their strength and flesh withered from

fasting and praying, from hunger and thirst; for they had not tasted

either food or drink since they left the garden; nor were the functions

of their bodies yet settled; and they had no strength left to continue

in prayer from hunger, until the end of the next day to the fortieth.

They were fallen down in the cave; yet what speech escaped from their

mouths, was only in praises.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:1
verses.text:
Then on the eighty-ninth day, Satan came to the cave, clad in a

garment of light, and girt about with a bright girdle.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:2
verses.text:
In his hands was a staff of light, and he looked most awful; but his

face was pleasant and his speech was sweet.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:3
verses.text:
He thus transformed himself in order to deceive Adam and Eve, and to

make them come out of the cave, before they had fulfilled the forty

days.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:4
verses.text:
For he said within himself, "Now that when they had fulfilled the

forty days' fasting and praying, God would restore them to their former

state; but if He did not do so, He would still be favorable to them;

and even if He had not mercy on them, would He yet give them something

from the garden to comfort them; as already twice before."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:5
verses.text: Then Satan drew near the cave in this fair appearance, and said:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:6
verses.text:
"O Adam, get up, stand up, you and Eve, and come along with me, to a

good land; and don't be afraid.  I am flesh and bones like you; and at

first I was a creature that God created.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:7
verses.text:
And it was so, that when He had created me, He placed me in a garden

in the north, on the border of the world.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:8
verses.text:
And He said to me, 'Stay here!'  And I remained there according to

His Word, neither did I transgress His commandment.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:9
verses.text:
Then He made a slumber to come over me, and He brought you, O Adam,

out of my side, but did not make you stay with me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:10
verses.text:
But God took you in His divine hand, and placed you in a garden to

the eastward.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:11
verses.text:
Then I worried about you, for that while God had taken you out of my

side, He had not let you stay with me.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:12
verses.text:
But God said to me: 'Do not worry about Adam, whom I brought out of

your side; no harm will come to him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:13
verses.text:
For now I have brought out of his side a help-meet for him; and I

have given him joy by so doing.'"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:14
verses.text:
Then Satan said again, "I did not know how it is you are in this

cave, nor anything about this trial that has come over you--until God

said to me, 'Behold, Adam has transgressed, he whom I had taken out of

your side, and Eve also, whom I took out of his side; and I have driven

them out of the garden; I have made them live in a land of sorrow and

misery, because they transgressed against Me, and have obeyed Satan.

And look, they are in suffering until this day, the eightieth.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:15
verses.text:
Then God said to me, 'Get up, go to them, and make them come to your

place, and suffer not that Satan come near them, and afflict them.  For

they are now in great misery; and lie helpless from hunger.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:16
verses.text:
He further said to me, 'When you have taken them to yourself, give

them to eat of the fruit of the Tree of Life, and give them to drink of

the water of peace; and clothe them in a garment of light, and restore

them to their former state of grace, and leave them not in misery, for

they came from you.  But grieve not over them, nor repent of that which

has come over them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:17
verses.text:
But when I heard this, I was sorry; and my heart could not patiently

bear it for your sake, O my child.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:18
verses.text:
But, O Adam, when I heard the name of Satan, I was afraid, and I

said within myself, I will not come out because he might trap me as he

did my children, Adam and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:19
verses.text:
And I said, 'O God, when I go to my children, Satan will meet me in

the way, and war against me, as he did against them.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:20
verses.text:
Then God said to me, 'Fear not; when you find him, hit him with the

staff that is in thine hand, and don't be afraid of him, for you are of

old standing, and he shall not prevail against you.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:21
verses.text:
Then I said, 'O my Lord, I am old, and cannot go.  Send Your angels

to bring them.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:22
verses.text:
But God said to me, 'Angels, verily, are not like them; and they

will not consent to come with them.  But I have chosen you, because

they are your offspring and are like you, and they will listen to what

you say.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:23
verses.text:
God said further to me, 'If you don't have enough strength to walk,

I will send a cloud to carry you and set you down at the entrance of

their cave; then the cloud will return and leave you there.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:24
verses.text:
And if they will come with you, I will send a cloud to carry you and

them.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:25
verses.text:
Then He commanded a cloud, and it bear me up and brought me to you;

and then went back.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:26
verses.text:
And now, O my children, Adam and Eve, look at my old gray hair and

at my feeble state, and at my coming from that distant place.  Come,

come with me, to a place of rest."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:27
verses.text:
Then he began to cry and to sob before Adam and Eve, and his tears

poured on the ground like water.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:28
verses.text:
And when Adam and Eve raised their eyes and saw his beard, and heard

his sweet talk, their hearts softened towards him; they obeyed him, for

they believed he was true.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 60:29
verses.text:
And it seemed to them that they were really his offspring, when they

saw that his face was like their own; and they trusted him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:1
verses.text:
Then he took Adam and Eve by the hand, and began to bring them out of

the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:2
verses.text:
But when they had come a little ways out of it, God knew that Satan

had overcome them, and had brought them out before the forty days were

ended, to take them to some distant place, and to destroy them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:3
verses.text:
Then the Word of the Lord God again came and cursed Satan, and drove

him away from them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:4
verses.text:
And God began to speak to Adam and Eve, saying to them, "What made

you come out of the cave, to this place?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:5
verses.text:
Then Adam said to God, "Did you create a man before us?  For when we

were in the cave there suddenly came to us a friendly old man who said

to us, 'I am a messenger from God to you, to bring you back to some

place of rest.'

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:6
verses.text:
And we believed, O God, that he was a messenger from you; and we came

out with him; and knew not where we should go with him."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:7
verses.text:
Then God said to Adam, "See, that is the father of evil arts, who

brought you and Eve out of the Garden of Delights.  And now, indeed,

when he saw that you and Eve both joined together in fasting and

praying, and that you came not out of the cave before the end of the

forty days, he wished to make your purpose vein, to break your mutual

bond; to cut off all hope from you, and to drive you to some place

where he might destroy you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:8
verses.text:
Because he couldn't do anything to you unless he showed himself in

the likeness of you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:9
verses.text:
Therefore he came to you with a face like your own, and began to give

you tokens as if they were all true.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:10
verses.text:
But because I am merciful and am favorable to you, I did not allow

him to destroy you; instead I drove him away from you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:11
verses.text:
Now, therefore, O Adam, take Eve, and return to your cave, and

remain in it until the morning after  the fortieth day.  And when you

come out, go towards the eastern gate of the garden."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:12
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve worshipped God, and praised and blessed Him for

the deliverance that had come to them from Him.  And they returned

towards the cave.  This happened in the evening of the thirty-ninth day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:13
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve stood up and with a fiery passion, prayed to God,

to give them strength; for they had become weak because of  hunger and

thirst and prayer.  But they watched the whole of that night praying,

until morning.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:14
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "Get up, let us go towards the eastern gate

of the garden as God told us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:15
verses.text:
And they said their prayers as they were accustomed to do every day;

and they left the cave to go near to the eastern gate of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:16
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve stood up and prayed, and appealed to God to

strengthen them, and to send them something to satisfy their hunger.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:17
verses.text: But after they finished their prayers, they were too weak to move.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:18
verses.text:
Then came the Word of God again, and said to them, "O Adam, get up,

go and bring the two figs here."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 61:19
verses.text: Then Adam and Eve got up, and went until they came near to the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 62:1
verses.text:
But Satan the wicked was envious, because of the consolation God had

given them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 62:2
verses.text:
So he prevented them, and went into the cave and took the two figs,

and buried them outside the cave, so that Adam and Eve should not find

them.  He also had in his thoughts to destroy them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 62:3
verses.text:
But by God's mercy, as soon as those two figs were in the ground, God

defeated Satan's counsel regarding them; and made them into two fruit

trees, that overshadowed the cave.  For Satan had buried them on the

eastern side of it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 62:4
verses.text:
Then when the two trees were grown, and were covered with fruit,

Satan grieved and mourned, and said, "It would have been better to have

left those figs where they were; for now, behold, they have become two

fruit trees, whereof Adam will eat all the days of his life.  Whereas I

had in mind, when I buried them, to destroy them entirely, and to hide

them forever.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 62:5
verses.text:
But God has overturned my counsel; and would not that this sacred

fruit should perish; and He has made plain my intention, and has

defeated the counsel I had formed against His servants."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 62:6
verses.text:
Then Satan went away ashamed because he hadn't thought his plans all

the way through.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:1
verses.text:
But Adam and Eve, as they got closer to the cave, saw two fig trees,

covered with fruit, and overshadowing the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:2
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "It seems to me that we have gone the wrong

way.  When did these two trees grow here?  It seems to me that the

enemy wishes to lead us the wrong way.  Do you suppose that there is

another cave besides this one in the earth?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:3
verses.text:
Yet, O Eve, let us go into the cave, and find in it the two figs; for

this is our cave, in which we were.  But if we should not find the two

figs in it, then it cannot be our cave."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:4
verses.text:
They went then into the cave, and looked into the four corners of it,

but found not the two figs.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:5
verses.text:
And Adam cried and said to Eve, "Did we go to the wrong cave, then, O

Eve?  It seems to me these two fig trees are the two figs that were in

the cave."  And Eve said, "I, for my part, do not know."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:6
verses.text:
Then Adam stood up and prayed and said, "O God, You commanded us to

come back to the cave, to take the two figs, and then to return to you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:7
verses.text:
But now, we have not found them.  O God, have you taken them, and

sown these two trees, or have we gone astray in the earth; or has the

enemy deceived us?  If it be real, then, O God, reveal to us the secret

of these two trees and of the two figs."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:8
verses.text:
Then came the Word of God to Adam, and said to him, "O Adam, when I

sent you to fetch the figs, Satan went before you to the cave, took the

figs, and buried them outside, eastward of the cave, thinking to

destroy them; and not sowing them with good intent.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:9
verses.text:
Not for his mere sake, then, have these trees grown up at once; but I

had mercy on you and I commanded them to grow.  And they grew to be two

large trees, that you be overshadowed by their branches, and find rest;

and that I made you see My power and My marvelous works.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:10
verses.text:
And, also, to show you Satan's meanness, and his evil works, for

ever since you came out of the garden, he has not ceased, no, not one

day, from doing you some harm.  But I have not given him power over

you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:11
verses.text:
And God said, "From now on, O Adam, rejoice on account of the trees,

you and Eve; and rest under them when you feel weary.  But do not eat

any of their fruit or come near them."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:12
verses.text:
Then Adam cried, and said, "O God, will You again kill us, or will

You drive us away from before Your face, and cut our life from off the

face of the earth?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:13
verses.text:
O God, I beg you, if You know that there be in these trees either

death or some other evil, as at the first time, root them up from near

our cave, and with them; and leave us to die of the heat, of hunger and

of thirst.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 63:14
verses.text:
For we know Your marvelous works, O God, that they are great, and

that by Your power You can bring one thing out of another, without

one's wish.  For Your power can make rocks to become trees, and trees

to become rocks."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:1
verses.text:
Then God looked at Adam and at his strength of mind, at his endurance

of hunger and thirst, and of the heat.  And He changed the two fig

trees into two figs, as they were at first, and then said to Adam and

to Eve, "Each of you may take one fig."  And they took them, as the

Lord commanded them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:2
verses.text:
And He said to them, "You must now go into the cave and eat the figs,

and satisfy your hunger, or else you will die."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:3
verses.text:
So, as God commanded them, they went into the cave about sunset.  And

Adam and Eve stood up and prayed during the setting sun.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:4
verses.text:
Then they sat down to eat the figs; but they knew not how to eat

them; for they were not accustomed to eat earthly food.  They were

afraid that if they ate, their stomach would be burdened and their

flesh thickened, and their hearts would take to liking earthly food.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:5
verses.text:
But while they were thus seated, God, out of pity for them, sent them

His angel, so they wouldn't perish of hunger and thirst.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:6
verses.text:
And the angel said to Adam and Eve, "God says to you that you do not

have the strength that would be required to fast until death; eat,

therefore, and strengthen your bodies; for you are now animal flesh and

cannot subsist without food and drink."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:7
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve took the figs and began to eat of them.  But God

had put into them a mixture as of savory bread and blood.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:8
verses.text:
Then the angel went from Adam and Eve, who ate of the figs until they

had satisfied their hunger.  Then they put aside what was left; but by

the power of God, the figs became whole again, because God blessed them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 64:9
verses.text:
After this Adam and Eve got up, and prayed with a joyful heart and

renewed strength, and praised and rejoiced abundantly the whole of that

night.  And this was the end of the eighty-third day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:1
verses.text:
And when it was day, they got up and prayed, after their custom, and

then went out of the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:2
verses.text:
But they became sick from the food they had eaten because they were

not used to it, so they went about in the cave saying to each other:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:3
verses.text:
"What has our eating caused to happen to us, that we should be in

such pain?  We are in misery, we shall die!  It would have been better

for us to have died keeping our bodies pure than to have eaten and

defiled them with food."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:4
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "This pain did not come to us in the garden,

neither did we eat such bad food there.  Do you think, O Eve, that God

will plague us through the food that is in us, or that our innards will

come out; or that God means to kill us with this pain before He has

fulfilled His promise to us?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:5
verses.text:
Then Adam besought the Lord and said, "O Lord, let us not perish

through the food we have eaten.  O Lord, don't punish us; but deal with

us according to Your great mercy, and forsake us not until the day of

the promise You have made us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:6
verses.text:
Then God looked at them, and then fitted them for eating food at

once; as to this day; so that they should not perish.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:7
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve came back into the cave sorrowful and crying

because of the alteration of their bodies.  And they both knew from

that hour that they were altered beings, that all hope of returning to

the garden was now lost; and that they could not enter it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:8
verses.text:
For that now their bodies had strange functions; and all flesh that

requires food and drink for its existence, cannot be in the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:9
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "Behold, our hope is now lost; and so is our

trust to enter the garden.  We no longer belong to the inhabitants of

the garden; but from now on we are earthy and of the dust, and of the

inhabitants of the earth.  We shall not return to the garden, until the

day in which God has promised to save us, and to bring us again into

the garden, as He promised us."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 65:10
verses.text:
Then they prayed to God that He would have mercy on them; after

which, their mind was quieted, their hearts were broken, and their

longing was cooled down; and they were like strangers on earth.  That

night Adam and Eve spent in the cave, where they slept heavily by

reason of the food they had eaten.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:1
verses.text:
When it was morning, the day after they had eaten food, Adam and Eve

prayed in the cave, and Adam said to Eve, "Look, we asked for food of

God, and He gave it.  But now let us also ask Him to give us a drink of

water."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:2
verses.text:
Then they got up, and went to the bank of the stream of water, that

was on the south border of the garden, in which they had before thrown

themselves.  And they stood on the bank, and prayed to God that He

would command them to drink of the water.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:3
verses.text:
Then the Word of God came to Adam, and said to him, "O Adam, your

body has become brutish, and requires water to drink.  Take some and

drink it, you and Eve, then give thanks and praise."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:4
verses.text:
Adam and Eve then went down to the stream and drank from it, until

their bodies felt refreshed.  After having drunk, they praised God, and

then returned to their cave, after their former custom.  This happened

at the end of eighty-three days.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:5
verses.text:
Then on the eighty-fourth day, they took the two figs and hung them

in the cave, together with the leaves thereof, to be to them a sign and

a blessing from God.  And they placed them there so that if their

descendants came there, they would see the wonderful things God had

done for them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:6
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve again stood outside the cave, and asked God to show

them some food with which they could nourish their bodies.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:7
verses.text:
Then the Word of God came and said to him, "O Adam, go down to the

westward of the cave until you come to a land of dark soil, and there

you shall find food."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:8
verses.text:
And Adam obeyed the Word of God, took Eve, and went down to a land of

dark soil, and found there wheat growing in the ear and ripe, and figs

to eat; and Adam rejoiced over it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:9
verses.text:
Then the Word of God came again to Adam, and said to him, "Take some

of this wheat and make yourselves some bread with it, to nourish your

body therewith."  And God gave Adam's heart wisdom, to work out the

corn until it became bread.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 66:10
verses.text:
Adam accomplished all that, until he grew very faint and weary.  He

then returned to the cave; rejoicing at what he had learned of what is

done with wheat, until it is made into bread for one's use.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:1
verses.text:
When Adam and Eve went down to the land of black mud and came near to

the wheat God had showed them and saw that it was ripe and ready for

reaping, they did not have a sickle to reap it with.  So they readied

themselves, and began to pull up the wheat by hand, until it was all

done.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:2
verses.text:
Then they heaped it into a pile; and, faint from heat and from

thirst, they went under a shady tree, where the breeze fanned them to

sleep.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:3
verses.text:
But Satan saw what Adam and Eve had done.  And he called his hosts,

and said to them, "Since God has shown to Adam and Eve all about this

wheat, wherewith to strengthen their bodies--and, look, they have come

and made a big pile of it, and faint from the toil are now

asleep--come, let us set fire to this heap of corn, and burn it, and

let us take that bottle of water that is by them, and empty it out, so

that they may find nothing to drink, and we kill them with hunger and

thirst.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:4
verses.text:
Then, when they wake up from their sleep, and seek to return to the

cave, we will come to them in the way, and will lead them astray; so

that they die of hunger and thirst; when they may, perhaps, deny God,

and He destroy them.  So shall we be rid of them."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:5
verses.text: Then Satan and his hosts set the wheat on fire and burned it up.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:6
verses.text:
But from the heat of the flame Adam and Eve awoke from their sleep,

and saw the wheat burning, and the bucket of water by them, poured out.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:7
verses.text: Then they cried and went back to the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:8
verses.text:
But as they were going up from below the mountain where they were,

Satan and his hosts met them in the form of angels, praising God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:9
verses.text:
Then Satan said to Adam, "O Adam, why are you so pained with hunger

and thirst?  It seems to me that Satan has burnt up the wheat."  And

Adam said to him, "Yes."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:10
verses.text:
Again Satan said to Adam, "Come back with us; we are angels of God.

God sent us to you, to show you another field of corn, better than

that; and beyond it is a fountain of good water, and many trees, where

you shall live near it, and work the corn field to better purpose than

that which Satan has consumed."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:11
verses.text:
Adam thought that he was true, and that they were angels who talked

with him; and he went back with them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 67:12
verses.text:
Then Satan began to lead astray Adam and Eve eight days, until they

both fell down as if dead, from hunger, thirst, and faintness.  Then he

fled with his hosts, and left them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:1
verses.text:
Then God looked at Adam and Eve, and at what had come over them from

Satan, and how he had made them perish.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:2
verses.text:
God, therefore, sent His Word, and raised up Adam and Eve from their

state of death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:3
verses.text:
Then, Adam, when he was raised, said, "O God, You have burnt and

taken from us the corn You have given us, and You have emptied out the

bucket of water.  And You have sent Your angels, who have caused us to

lose our way from the corn field.  Will You make us perish?  If this be

from you, O God, then take away our souls; but punish us not."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:4
verses.text:
Then God said to Adam, "I did not burn down the wheat, and I did not

pour the water out of the bucket, and I did not send My angels to lead

you astray.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:5
verses.text:
But it is Satan, your master who did it; he to whom you have

subjected yourself; my commandment being meanwhile set aside.  He it

is, who burnt down the corn, and poured out the water, and who has led

you astray; and all the promises he has made you were just a trick, a

deception, and a lie.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:6
verses.text: But now, O Adam, you shall acknowledge My good deeds done to you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:7
verses.text:
And God told His angels to take Adam and Eve, and to bear them up to

the field of wheat, which they found as before, with the bucket full of

water.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:8
verses.text:
There they saw a tree, and found on it solid manna; and wondered at

God's power.  And the angels commanded them to eat of the manna when

they were hungry.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:9
verses.text:
And God admonished Satan with a curse, not to come again, and destroy

the field of corn.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:10
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve took of the corn, and made of it an offering, and

took it and offered it up on the mountain, the place where they had

offered up their first offering of blood.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:11
verses.text:
And they offered this offering again on the altar they had built at

first.  And they stood up and prayed, and besought the Lord saying,

"Thus, O God, when we were in the garden,  our praises went up to you,

like this offering; and our innocence went up to you like incense.  But

now, O God, accept this offering from us, and don't turn us away,

deprived of Your mercy."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:12
verses.text:
Then God said to Adam and Eve, "Since you have made this offering

and have offered it to Me, I shall make it My flesh, when I come down

on earth to save you; and I shall cause it to be offered continually on

an altar, for forgiveness and for mercy, for those who partake of it

duly."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:13
verses.text:
And God sent a bright fire over the offering of Adam and Eve, and

filled it with brightness, grace, and light; and the Holy Ghost came

down on that offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:14
verses.text:
Then God commanded an angel to take fire tongs, like a spoon, and

with it to take an offering and bring it to Adam and Eve.  And the

angel did so, as God had commanded him, and offered it to them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:15
verses.text:
And the souls of Adam and Eve were brightened, and their hearts were

filled with joy and gladness and with the praises of God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:16
verses.text:
And God said to Adam, "This shall be to  you a custom, to do so,

when affliction and sorrow come over you.  But your deliverance and

your entrance in to the garden, shall not be until the days are

fulfilled as agreed between you and Me; were it not so, I would, of My

mercy and pity for you, bring you back to My garden and to My favor for

the sake of the offering you have just made to My name."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:17
verses.text:
Adam rejoiced at these words which he heard from God; and he and Eve

worshipped before the altar, to which they bowed, and then went back to

the Cave of Treasures.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:18
verses.text:
And this took place at the end of the twelfth day after the

eightieth day, from the time Adam and Eve came out of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:19
verses.text:
And they stood up the whole night praying until morning; and then

went out of the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:20
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, with joy of heart, because of the offering

they had made to God, and that had been accepted of Him, "Let us do

this three times every week, on the fourth day Wednesday, on the

preparation day Friday, and on the Sabbath Sunday, all the days of our

life."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:21
verses.text:
And as they agreed to these words between themselves, God was

pleased with their thoughts, and with the resolution they had each

taken with the other.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:22
verses.text:
After this, came the Word of God to Adam, and said, "O Adam, you

have determined beforehand the days in which sufferings shall come over

Me, when I am made flesh; for they are the fourth Wednesday, and the

preparation day Friday.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:23
verses.text:
But as to the first day, I created in it all things, and I raised

the heavens.  And, again, through My rising again on this day, will I

create joy, and raise them on high, who believe in Me; O Adam, offer

this offering, all the days of your life."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:24
verses.text: Then God withdrew His Word from Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 68:25
verses.text:
But Adam continued to offer this offering thus, every week three

times, until the end of seven weeks.  And on the first day, which is

the fiftieth, Adam made an offering as he was accustomed, and he and

Eve took it and came to the altar before God, as He had taught them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:1
verses.text:
Then Satan, the hater of all good, envious of Adam and of his

offering through which he found favor with God, hastened and took a

sharp stone from among the sharp iron stones; appeared in the form of a

man, and went and stood by Adam and Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:2
verses.text:
Adam was then offering on the altar, and had begun to pray, with his

hands spread before God.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:3
verses.text:
Then Satan hastened with the sharp iron stone he had with him, and

with it pierced Adam on the right side, from which flowed blood and

water, then Adam fell on the altar like a corpse.  And Satan fled.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:4
verses.text:
Then Eve came, and took Adam and placed him below the altar.  And

there she stayed, crying over him; while a stream of blood flowed from

Adam's side over his offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:5
verses.text:
But God looked at the death of Adam.  He then sent His Word, and

raised him up and said to him, "Fulfil your offering, for indeed, Adam,

it is worth much, and there is no shortcoming in it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:6
verses.text:
God said further to Adam, "Thus will it also happen to Me, on the

earth, when I shall be pierced and blood and water shall flow from My

side and run over My body, which is the true offering; and which shall

be offered on the altar as a perfect offering."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:7
verses.text:
Then God commanded Adam to finish his offering, and when he had ended
