it he worshipped before God, and praised Him for the signs He had

showed him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:8
verses.text:
And God healed Adam in one day, which is the end of the seven weeks;

and that is the fiftieth day.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:9
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve returned from the mountain, and went into the Cave

of Treasures, as they were used to do.  This completed for Adam and

Eve, one hundred and forty days since their coming out of the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:10
verses.text:
Then they both stood up that night and prayed to God.  And when it

was morning, they went out, and went down westward of the cave, to the

place where their corn was, and there rested under the shadow of a

tree, as they were accustomed.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 69:11
verses.text:
But when there a multitude of beasts came all around them.  It was

Satan's doing, in his wickedness; in order to wage war against Adam

through marriage.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:1
verses.text:
After this Satan, the hater of all good, took the form of an angel,

and with him two others, so that they looked like the three angels who

had brought to Adam gold, incense, and myrrh.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:2
verses.text:
They passed before Adam and Eve while they were under the tree, and

greeted Adam and Eve with fair words that were full of deceit.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:3
verses.text:
But when Adam and Eve saw their pleasant expression, and heard their

sweet speech, Adam rose, welcomed them, and brought them to Eve, and

they remained all together; Adam's heart the while, being glad because

he thought concerning them, that they were the same angels, who had

brought him gold, incense, and myrrh.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:4
verses.text:
Because, when they came to Adam the first time, there came over him

from them, peace and joy, through their bringing him good tokens; so

Adam thought that they had come a second time to give him other tokens

for him to rejoice therewith.  For he did not know it was Satan;

therefore he received them with joy and consorted with them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:5
verses.text:
Then Satan, the tallest of them, said, "Rejoice, O Adam, and be glad.

Look, God has sent us to you to tell you something."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:6
verses.text:
And Adam said, "What is it?"  Then Satan answered, "It is a simple

thing, yet it is the Word of God, will you accept it from us and do it?

But if you will not accept it, we will return to God, and tell Him that

you would not receive His Word."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:7
verses.text:
And Satan said again to Adam, "Don't be afraid and don't tremble;

don't you know us?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:8
verses.text: But Adam said, "I do not know you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:9
verses.text:
Then Satan said to him, "I am the angel that brought you gold, and

took it to the cave; this other angel is the one that brought you

incense; and that third angel, is the one who brought you myrrh when

you were on top of the mountain, and who carried you to the cave.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:10
verses.text:
But as to the other angels our fellows, who bare you to the cave,

God has not sent them with us this time; for He said to us, 'You will

be enough'."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:11
verses.text:
So when Adam heard these words he believed them, and said to these

angels, "Speak the Word of God, that I may receive it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:12
verses.text:
And Satan said to him, "Swear, and promise me that you will receive

it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:13
verses.text: Then Adam said, "I do not know how to swear and promise."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:14
verses.text:
And Satan said to him, "Hold out your hand, and put it inside my

hand."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:15
verses.text:
Then Adam held out his hand, and put it into Satan's hand; when

Satan said to him, "Say, now--So true as God is living, rational, and

speaking, who raised the stars in heaven, and established the dry

ground on the waters, and has created me out of the four elements, and

out of the dust of the earth--I will not break my promise, nor renounce

my word."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:16
verses.text: And Adam swore thus.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 70:17
verses.text:
Then Satan said to him, "Look, it is now some time since you came

out of the garden, and you know neither wickedness nor evil.  But now

God says to you, to take Eve who came out of your side, and to marry

her so that she will bear you children, to comfort you, and to drive

from you trouble and sorrow; now this thing is not difficult, neither

is there any scandal in it to you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:1
verses.text:
But when Adam heard these words from Satan, he sorrowed much, because

of his oath and of his promise, and said, "Shall I commit adultery with

my flesh and my bones, and shall I sin against myself, for God to

destroy me, and to blot me out from off the face of the earth?

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:2
verses.text:
Since, when at first, I ate of the tree, He drove me out of the

garden into this strange land, and deprived me of my bright nature, and

brought death over me.  If, then, I should do this, He will cut off my

life from the earth, and He will cast me into hell, and will plague me

there a long time.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:3
verses.text:
But God never spoke the words that you have said; and you are not

God's angels, and you weren't sent from Him.  But you are devils that

have come to me under the false appearance of angels.  Away from me;

you cursed of God!"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:4
verses.text:
Then those devils fled from before Adam.  And he and Eve got up, and

returned to the Cave of Treasures, and went into it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:5
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "If you saw what I did, don't tell anyone; for

I sinned against God in swearing by His great name, and I have placed

my hand another time into that of Satan."  Eve, then, held her peace,

as Adam told her.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:6
verses.text:
Then Adam got up, and spread his hands before God, beseeching and

entreating Him with tears, to forgive him what he had done.  And Adam

remained thus standing and praying forty days and forty nights.  He

neither ate nor drank until he dropped down on the ground from hunger

and thirst.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:7
verses.text:
Then God sent His Word to Adam, who raised him up from where he lay,

and said to him, "O Adam, why have you sworn by My name, and why have

you made agreement with Satan another time?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:8
verses.text:
But Adam cried, and said, "O God, forgive me, for I did this

unwittingly; believing they were God's angels."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:9
verses.text: And God forgave Adam, saying to him, "Beware of Satan."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:10
verses.text: And He withdrew His Word from Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:11
verses.text:
Then Adam's heart was comforted; and he took Eve, and they went out

of the cave, to prepare some food for their bodies.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:12
verses.text:
But from that day Adam struggled in his mind about his marrying Eve;

afraid that if he was to do it, God would be angry with him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:13
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve went to the river of water, and sat on the bank,

as people do when they enjoy themselves.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 71:14
verses.text: But Satan was jealous of them; and planned to destroy them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:1
verses.text:
Then Satan, and ten from his hosts, transformed themselves into

maidens, unlike any others in the whole world for grace.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:2
verses.text:
They came up out of the river in presence of Adam and Eve, and they

said among themselves, "Come, we will look at the faces of Adam and

Eve, who are of the men on earth.  How beautiful they are, and how

different is their look from our own faces."  Then they came to Adam

and Eve, and greeted them; and stood wondering at them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:3
verses.text:
Adam and Eve looked at them also, and wondered at their beauty, and

said, "Is there, then, under us, another world, with such beautiful

creatures as these in it?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:4
verses.text:
And those maidens said to Adam and Eve, "Yes, indeed, we are an

abundant creation."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:5
verses.text: Then Adam said to them, "But how do you multiply?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:6
verses.text:
And they answered him, "We have husbands who have married us, and we

bear them children, who grow up, and who in their turn marry and are

married, and also bear children; and thus we increase.  And if so be, O

Adam, you will not believe us, we will show you our husbands and our

children."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:7
verses.text:
Then they shouted over the river as if to call their husbands and

their children, who came up from the river, men and children; and every

man came to his wife, his children being with him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:8
verses.text: But when Adam and Eve saw them, they stood dumb, and wondered at them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:9
verses.text:
Then they said to Adam and Eve, "See all our husbands and our

children?  You should marry Eve, as we have married our husbands, so

that you will have children as we have." This was a device of Satan to

deceive Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:10
verses.text:
Satan also thought within himself, "God at first commanded Adam

concerning the fruit of the tree, saying to him, 'Eat not of it; else

of death you shall die.'  But Adam ate of it, and yet God did not kill

him; He only decreed on him death, and plagues and trials, until the

day he shall come out of his body.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:11
verses.text:
Now, then, if I deceive him to do this thing, and to marry Eve

without God's permission, God will kill him then."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:12
verses.text:
Therefore Satan worked this apparition before Adam and Eve; because

he sought to kill him, and to make him disappear from off the face of

the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:13
verses.text:
Meanwhile the fire of sin came over Adam, and he thought of

committing sin.  But he restrained himself, fearing that if he followed

this advice of Satan, God would put him to death.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:14
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve got up, and prayed to God, while Satan and his

hosts went down into the river, in presence of Adam and Eve; to let

them see that they were going back to their own world.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:15
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve went back to the Cave of Treasures, as they

usually did; about evening time.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:16
verses.text:
And they both got up and prayed to God that night.  Adam remained

standing in prayer, yet not knowing how to pray, by reason of the

thoughts in his heart regarding his marrying Eve; and he continued so

until morning.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:17
verses.text:
And when light came up, Adam said to Eve, "Get up, let us go below

the mountain, where they brought us gold, and let us ask the Lord

concerning this matter."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:18
verses.text: Then Eve said, "What is that matter, O Adam?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:19
verses.text:
And he answered her, "That I may request the Lord to inform me about

marrying you; for I will not do it without His permission or else He

will make us perish, you and me.  For those devils have set my heart on

fire, with thoughts of what they showed us, in their sinful apparitions.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:20
verses.text:
Then Eve said to Adam, "Why need we go below the mountain?  Let us

rather stand up and pray in our cave to God, to let us know whether

this counsel is good or not."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:21
verses.text:
Then Adam rose up in prayer and said, "O God, you know that we

transgressed against you, and from the moment we transgressed, we were

stripped of our bright nature; and our body became brutish, requiring

food and drink; and with animal desires.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:22
verses.text:
Command us, O God, not to give way to them without Your permission,

for fear that You will turn us into nothing.  Because if you do not

give us permission, we shall be overpowered, and follow that advice of

Satan; and You will again make us perish.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:23
verses.text:
If not, then take our souls from us; let us be rid of this animal

lust.  And if You give us no order respecting this thing, then sever

Eve from me, and me from her; and place us each far away from the other.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 72:24
verses.text:
Then again, O God, if You separate us from each other, the devils

will deceive us with their apparitions that resemble us, and destroy

our hearts, and defile our thoughts towards each other.  Yet if it is

not each of us towards the other, it will, at all events, be through

their appearance when the devils come to us in our likeness." Here Adam

ended his prayer.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:1
verses.text:
Then God considered the words of Adam that they were true, and that

he could long await His order, respecting the counsel of Satan.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:2
verses.text:
And God approved Adam in what he had thought concerning this, and in

the prayer he had offered in His presence; and the Word of God came to

Adam and said to him, "O Adam, if only you had had this caution at

first, before you came out of the garden into this land!"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:3
verses.text:
After that, God sent His angel who had brought gold, and the angel

who had brought incense, and the angel who had brought myrrh to Adam,

that they should inform him respecting his marriage to Eve.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:4
verses.text:
Then those angels said to Adam, "Take the gold and give it to Eve as

a wedding gift, and promise to marry her; then give her some incense

and myrrh as a present; and be you, you and she, one flesh."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:5
verses.text:
Adam obeyed the angels, and took the gold and put it into Eve's bosom

in her garment; and promised to marry her with his hand.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:6
verses.text:
Then the angels commanded Adam and Eve to get up and pray forty days

and forty nights; when that was done, then Adam was to have sexual

intercourse with his wife; for then this would be an act pure and

undefiled; so that he would have children who would multiply, and

replenish the face of the earth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:7
verses.text:
Then both Adam and Eve received the words of the angels; and the

angels departed from them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:8
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve began to fast and pray, until the end of the forty

days; and then they had sexual intercourse, as the angels had told

them.  And from the time Adam left the garden until he wedded Eve, were

two hundred and twenty-three days, that is seven months and thirteen

days.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 73:9
verses.text: Thus was Satan's war with Adam defeated.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:1
verses.text:
And they lived on the earth working in order to keep their bodies in

good health; and they continued so until the nine months of Eve's

pregnancy were over, and the time drew near when she must give birth.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:2
verses.text:
Then she said to Adam, "The signs placed in this cave since we left

the garden indicate that this is a pure place and we will be praying in

it again some time.  It is not appropriate then, that I should give

birth in it.  Let us instead go to the sheltering rock cave that was

formed by the command of God when Satan threw a big rock down on us in

an attempt to kill us with it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:3
verses.text:
Adam then took Eve to that cave.  When the time came for her to give

birth, she strained a lot.  Adam felt sorry, and he was very worried

about her because she was close to death and the words of God to her

were being fulfilled: "In suffering shall you bear a child, and in

sorrow shall you bring forth a child."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:4
verses.text:
But when Adam saw the distress in which Eve was, he got up and prayed

to God, and said, "O Lord, look at me with the eye of Your mercy, and

bring her out of her distress."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:5
verses.text:
And God looked at His maid-servant Eve, and delivered her, and she

gave birth to her first-born son, and with him a daughter.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:6
verses.text:
The Adam rejoiced at Eve's deliverance, and also over the children

she had borne him.  And Adam ministered to Eve in the cave, until the

end of eight days; when they named the son Cain, and the daughter

Luluwa.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:7
verses.text:
The meaning of Cain is "hater," because he hated his sister in their

mother's womb; before they came out of it.  Therefore Adam named him

Cain.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:8
verses.text:
But Luluwa means "beautiful," because she was more beautiful than her

mother.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:9
verses.text:
Then Adam and Eve waited until Cain and his sister were forty days

old, when Adam said to Eve, "We will make an offering and offer it up

in behalf of the children."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 74:10
verses.text:
And Eve said, "We will make one offering for the first-born son and

then later we shall make one for the daughter."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:1
verses.text:
Then Adam prepared an offering, and he and Eve offered it up for

their children, and brought it to the altar they had built at first.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:2
verses.text:
And Adam offered up the offering, and asked God to accept his

offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:3
verses.text:
Then God accepted Adam's offering, and sent a light from heaven that

shown on the offering.  Adam and his son drew near to the offering, but

Eve and the daughter did not approach it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:4
verses.text:
Adam and his son were joyful as they came down from on the altar.

Adam and Eve waited until the daughter was eighty days old, then Adam

prepared an offering and took it to Eve and to the children. They went

to the altar, where Adam offered it up, as he was accustomed, asking

the Lord to accept his offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:5
verses.text:
And the Lord accepted the offering of Adam and Eve.  Then Adam, Eve,

and the children, drew near together, and came down from the mountain,

rejoicing.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:6
verses.text:
But they returned not to the cave in which they were born; but came

to the Cave of Treasures, in order that the children should go around

in it, and be blessed with the tokens brought from the garden.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:7
verses.text:
But after they had been blessed with these tokens, they went back to

the cave in which they were born.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:8
verses.text:
However, before Eve had offered up the offering, Adam had taken her,

and had gone with her to the river of water, in which they threw

themselves at first; and there they washed themselves.  Adam washed his

body and Eve hers also clean, after the suffering and distress that had

come over them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:9
verses.text:
But Adam and Eve, after washing themselves in the river of water,

returned every night to the Cave of Treasures, where they prayed and

were blessed; and then went back to their cave, where their children

were born.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:10
verses.text:
Adam and Eve did this until the children had been weaned.  After

they were weaned, Adam made an offering for the souls of his children

in addition to the three times every week he made an offering for them.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:11
verses.text:
When the children were weaned, Eve again conceived, and when her

pregnancy came to term, she gave birth to another son and daughter.

They named the son Abel and the daughter Aklia.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:12
verses.text:
Then at the end of forty days, Adam made an offering for the son,

and at the end of eighty days he made another offering for the

daughter, and treated them, as he had previously treated Cain and his

sister Luluwa.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 75:13
verses.text:
He brought them to the Cave of Treasures, where they received a

blessing, and then returned to the cave where they were born.  After

these children were born, Eve stopped having children.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:1
verses.text:
And the children began to grow stronger and taller; but Cain was

hard-hearted, and ruled over his younger brother.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:2
verses.text:
Often when his father made an offering, Cain would remain behind and

not go with them, to offer up.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:3
verses.text:
But, as to Abel, he had a meek heart, and was obedient to his father

and mother.  He frequently moved them to make an offering, because he

loved it.  He prayed and fasted a lot.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:4
verses.text:
Then came this sign to Abel.  As he was coming into the Cave of

Treasures, and saw the golden rods, the incense and the myrrh, he asked

his parents, Adam and Eve, to tell him about them and asked, "Where did

you get these from?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:5
verses.text:
Then Adam told him all that had befallen them.  And Abel felt deeply

about what his father told him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:6
verses.text:
Furthermore his father, Adam, told him of the works of God, and of

the garden.  After hearing that, Abel remained behind after his father

left and stayed the whole of that night in the Cave of Treasures.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:7
verses.text:
And that night, while he was praying, Satan appeared to him under the

figure of a man, who said to him, "You have frequently moved your

father into making offerings, fasting and praying, therefore I will

kill you, and make you perish from this world."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:8
verses.text:
But as for Abel, he prayed to God, and drove away Satan from him; and

did not believe the words of the devil.  Then when it was day, an angel

of God appeared to him, who said to him, "Do not cut short either

fasting, prayer, or offering up an offering to your God.  For, look,

the Lord had accepted your prayer.  Be not afraid of the figure which

appeared to you in the night, and who cursed you to death."  And the

angel departed from him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:9
verses.text:
Then when it was day, Abel came to Adam and Eve, and told them of the

vision he had seen.  When they heard it, they grieved much over it, but

said nothing to him about it; they only comforted him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:10
verses.text:
But as to the hard-hearted Cain, Satan came to him by night, showed

himself and said to him, "Since Adam and Eve love your brother Abel so

much more than they love you, they wish to join him in marriage to your

beautiful sister because they love him.  However, they wish to join you

in marriage to his ugly sister, because they hate you.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:11
verses.text:
Now before they do that, I am telling you that you should kill your

brother. That way your sister will be left for you, and his sister will

be cast away."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 76:12
verses.text:
And Satan departed from him.  But the devil remained behind in

Cain's heart, and frequently aspired to kill his brother.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:1
verses.text:
But when Adam saw that the older brother hated the younger, he

endeavored to soften their hearts, and said to Cain, "O my son, take of

the fruits of your sowing and make an offering to God, so that He might

forgive you for your wickedness and sin."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:2
verses.text:
He said also to Abel, "Take some of your sowing and make an offering

and bring it to God, so that He might forgive you for your wickedness

and sin."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:3
verses.text:
Then Abel obeyed his father's voice, took some of his sowing, and

made a good offering, and said to his father, Adam, "Come with me and

show me how to offer it up."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:4
verses.text:
And they went, Adam and Eve with him, and they showed him how to

offer up his gift on the altar.  Then after that, they stood up and

prayed that God would accept Abel's offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:5
verses.text:
Then God looked at Abel and accepted his offering.  And God was more

pleased with Abel than with his offering, because of his good heart and

pure body.  There was no trace of guile in him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:6
verses.text:
Then they came down from the altar, and went to the cave in which

they lived.  But Abel, by reason of his joy at having made his

offering, repeated it three times a week, after the example of his

father Adam.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:7
verses.text:
But as to Cain, he did not want to make an offering, but after his

father became very angry, he offered up a gift once.  He took the

smallest of his sheep for an offering and when he offered it up, his

eyes were on the lamb.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:8
verses.text:
Therefore God did not accept his offering, because his heart was full

of murderous thoughts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 77:9
verses.text:
And they all thus lived together in the cave in which Eve had brought

forth, until Cain was fifteen years old, and Abel twelve years old.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:1
verses.text:
Then Adam said to Eve, "Behold the children are grown up; we must

think of finding wives for them."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:2
verses.text: Then Eve answered, "How can we do it?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:3
verses.text:
Then Adam said to her, "We will join Abel's sister in marriage to

Cain, and Cain's sister to Abel.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:4
1 Adam and Eve 78:5
verses.text: And Adam said no more.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:6
verses.text:
Meanwhile Satan came to Cain in the figure of a man of the field, and

said to him, "Behold Adam and Eve have taken counsel together about the

marriage of you two; and they have agreed to marry Abel's sister to

you, and your sister to him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:7
verses.text:
But if it was not that I love you, I would not have told you this

thing.  Yet if you will take my advice, and obey me, I will bring to

you on your wedding day beautiful robes, gold and silver in plenty, and

my relations will attend you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:8
verses.text: Then Cain said with joy, "Where are your relations?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:9
verses.text:
And Satan answered, "My relations are in a garden in the north, where

I once meant to bring your father Adam; but he would not accept my

offer.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:10
1 Adam and Eve 78:11
verses.text:
At these words of Satan Cain opened his ears, and leaned towards his

speech.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:12
verses.text:
And he did not remain in the field, but he went to Eve, his mother,

and beat her, and cursed her, and said to her, "Why are you planning to

take my sister to wed her to my brother?   Am I dead?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:13
verses.text:
His mother, however, quieted him, and sent him to the field where he

had been.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:14
verses.text: Then when Adam came, she told him of what Cain had done.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:15
verses.text: But Adam grieved and held his peace, and said not a word.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:16
verses.text:
Then on the next morning Adam said to Cain his son, "Take of your

sheep, young and good, and offer them up to your God; and I will speak

to your brother, to make to his God an offering of corn."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:17
verses.text:
They both obeyed their father Adam, and they took their offerings,

and offered them up on the mountain by the altar.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:18
verses.text:
But Cain behaved haughtily towards his brother, and shoved him from

the altar, and would not let him offer up his gift on the altar; but he

offered his own on it, with a proud heart, full of guile, and fraud.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:19
verses.text:
But as for Abel, he set up stones that were near at hand, and on

that, he offered up his gift with a heart humble and free from guile.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:20
verses.text:
Cain was then standing by the altar on which he had offered up his

gift; and he cried to God to accept his offering; but God did not

accept it from him; neither did a divine fire come down to consume his

offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:21
verses.text:
But he remained standing over against the altar, out of humor and

meanness, looking towards his brother Abel, to see if God would accept

his offering or not.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:22
verses.text:
And Abel prayed to God to accept his offering.  Then a divine fire

came down and consumed his offering.  And God smelled the sweet savor

of his offering; because Abel loved Him and rejoice in Him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:23
verses.text:
And because God was well pleased with him, He sent him an angel of

light in the figure of a man who had partaken of his offering, because

He had smelled the sweet savor of his offering, and they comforted Abel

and strengthened his heart.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:24
verses.text:
But Cain was looking on all that took place at his brother's

offering, and was angry because of it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:25
verses.text:
Then he opened his mouth and blasphemed God, because He had not

accepted his offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:26
verses.text:
But God said to cain, "Why do you look sad?  Be righteous, that I

may accept your offering.  Not against Me have you murmured, but

against yourself.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:27
verses.text:
And God said this to Cain in rebuke, and because He abhorred him and

his offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:28
verses.text:
And Cain came down from the altar, his color changed and with a sad

face, and came to his father and mother and told them all that had

befallen him.  And Adam grieved much because God had not accepted

Cain's offering.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:29
verses.text:
But Abel came down rejoicing, and with a gladsome heart, and told

his father and mother how God had accepted his offering.  And they

rejoiced at it and kissed his face.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:30
verses.text:
And Abel said to his father, "Because Cain shoved me from the altar,

and would not allow me to offer my gift on it, I made an altar for

myself and offered my gift on it."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:31
verses.text:
But when Adam heard this he was very sorry, because it was the altar

he had built at first, and on which he had offered his own gifts.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:32
verses.text:
As to Cain, he was so resentful and so angry that he went into the

field, where Satan came to him and said to him, "Since your brother

Abel has taken refuge with your father Adam, because you shoved him

from the altar, they have kissed his face, and they rejoice over him,

far more than over you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:33
verses.text:
When Cain heard these words of  Satan, he was filled with rage; and

he let no one know.  But he was laying wait to kill his brother, until

he brought him into the cave, and then said to him:--

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:34
verses.text:
"O brother, the country is so beautiful, and there are such

beautiful and pleasurable trees in it, and charming to look at!  But

brother, you have never been one day in the field to take your pleasure

in that place.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:35
verses.text:
Today, O, my brother, I very much wish you would come with me into

the field, to enjoy yourself and to bless our fields and our flocks,

for you are righteous, and I love you much, O my brother!  But you have

alienated yourself from me."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:36
verses.text: Then Abel consented to go with his brother Cain into the field.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:37
verses.text:
But before going out, Cain said to Abel, "Wait for me, until I fetch

a staff, because of wild beasts."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:38
verses.text:
Then Abel stood waiting in his innocence.  But Cain, the forward,

fetched a staff and went out.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 78:39
verses.text:
And they began, Cain and his brother Abel, to walk in the way; Cain

talking to him, and comforting him, to make him forget everything.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:1
verses.text:
And so they went on, until they came to a lonely place, where there

were no sheep; then Abel said to Cain, "Behold, my brother, we are

tired from walking; for we see none of the trees, nor of the fruits,

nor of the flourishing green plants, nor of the sheep, nor any one of

the things of which you told me.  Where are those sheep of thine you

told me to bless?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:2
verses.text:
Then Cain said to him, "Come on, and you shall see many beautiful

things very soon, but go before me, until I catch up to you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:3
verses.text: Then went Abel forward, but Cain remained behind him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:4
verses.text:
And Abel was walking in his innocence, without guile; not believing

his brother would kill him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:5
verses.text:
Then Cain, when he came up to him, comforted him with his talk,

walking a little behind him; then he ran up to him and beat him with

the staff, blow after blow, until he was stunned.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:6
verses.text:
But when Abel fell down on the ground, seeing that his brother meant

to kill him, he said to Cain, "O, my brother, have pity on me.  By the

breasts we have sucked, don't hit me!  By the womb that bore us and

that brought us into the world, don't beat me to death with that staff!

If you will kill me, take one of these large stones and kill me

outright."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:7
verses.text:
Then Cain, the hard-hearted, and cruel murderer, took a large stone,

and beat his brother's head with it, until his brains oozed out, and he

wallowed in his blood, before him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:8
verses.text: And Cain repented not of what he had done.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:9
verses.text:
But the earth, when the blood of righteous Abel fell on it, trembled,

as it drank his blood, and would have destroyed Cain because of it.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:10
verses.text:
And the blood of Abel cried mysteriously to God, to avenge him of

his murderer.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:11
verses.text:
Then Cain began at once to dig the ground wherein to lay his

brother; for he was trembling from the fear that came over him, when he

saw the earth tremble on his account.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:12
verses.text:
He then cast his brother into the pit he made, and covered him with

dust.  But the ground would not receive him; but it threw him up at

once.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:13
verses.text:
Again Cain dug the ground and hid his brother in it; but again the

ground threw him up on itself; until three times the ground thus threw

up on itself the body of Abel.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:14
verses.text:
The muddy ground threw him up the first time, because he was not the

first creation; and it threw him up the second time and would not

receive him, because he was righteous and good, and was killed without

a cause; and the ground threw him up the third time and would not

receive him, that there might remain before his brother a witness

against him.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:15
verses.text:
And so the earth mocked Cain, until the Word of God, came to him

concerning his brother.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:16
verses.text:
Then was God angry, and much displeased at Abel's death; and He

thundered from heaven, and lightnings went before Him, and the Word of

the Lord God came from heaven to Cain, and said to him, "Where is Abel

your brother?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:17
verses.text:
Then Cain answered with a proud heart and a gruff voice, "How, O

God?  Am I my brother's keeper?"

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:18
verses.text:
Then God said to Cain, "Cursed be the earth that has drunk the blood

of Abel your brother; and as for you, you will always be trembling and

shaking; and this will be a mark on you so that whoever finds you, will

kill you."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:19
verses.text:
But Cain cried because God had said those words to him; and Cain

said to Him, "O God, whosoever finds me shall kill me, and I shall be

blotted out from the face of the earth."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:20
verses.text:
Then God said to Cain, "Whoever finds you will not kill you;"

because before this, God had been saying to Cain, "I shall put seven

punishments on anyone that kills Cain." For as to the word of God to

Cain, "Where is your brother?" God said it in mercy for him, to try and

make him repent.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:21
verses.text:
For if Cain had repented at that time, and had said, "O God, forgive

me my sin, and the murder of my brother,"  God would then have forgiven

him his sin.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:22
verses.text:
And as to God saying to Cain, "Cursed be the ground that has drunk

the blood of your brother."  That also, was God's mercy on Cain.  For

God did not curse him, but He cursed the ground; although it was not

the ground that had killed Abel, and committed a wicked sin.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:23
verses.text:
For it was fitting that the curse should fall on the murderer; yet

in mercy did God so manage His thoughts as that no one should know it,

and turn away from Cain.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:24
verses.text:
And He said to him, "Where is your brother?" To which he answered

and said, "I know not." Then the Creator said to him, "Be trembling and

quaking."

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:25
verses.text:
Then Cain trembled and became terrified; and through this sign did

God make him an example before all the creation, as the murderer of his

brother.  Also did God bring trembling and terror over him, that he

might see the peace in which he was at first, and see also the

trembling and terror he endured at the last; so that he might humble

himself before God, and repent of his sin, and seek the peace that he

enjoyed at first.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:26
verses.text:
And in the word of God that said, "I will put seven punishments on

anyone who  kills Cain," God was not seeking to kill Cain with the

sword, but He sought to make him die of fasting, and praying and crying

by hard rule, until the time that he was delivered from his sin.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:27
verses.text:
And the seven punishments are the seven generations during which God

awaited Cain for the murder of his brother.

verses.name: 1 Adam and Eve 79:28
verses.text:
But as to Cain, ever since he had killed his brother, he could find

no rest in any place; but went back to Adam and Eve, trembling,

terrified, and defiled with blood. . . .
